original: dngos po gang dang gang ji ltar mos par byas pa de dag de bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni mos pa la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang ji ltar mos par byas pa de dag de bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni mos pa la dbang ba'o //
translated: The power of aspiration is the accomplishment of whatever one aspires to, in whatever way one aspires to it.

original: de'i smon lam thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni smon lam la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i smon lam thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni smon lam la dbang ba'o //
translated: The power of prayer is the accomplishment of all one’s prayers just as one wishes.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi dgos pa thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi dgos pa thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub pa 'di ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
translated: The power of miracles is the accomplishment of all the purposes of miracles just as one wishes.

original: gang yang shes par bya ba'i dngos por rab tu zab pa shes par 'dod pa de dag myur ba nyid du shes pa 'di ni ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang shes par bya ba'i dngos por rab tu zab pa shes par 'dod pa de dag myur ba nyid du shes pa 'di ni ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: The power of knowledge is the swift knowledge of whatever one wishes to know, even if it is very profound.

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par dgod pa la mkhas pa 'di ni chos la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par dgod pa la mkhas pa 'di ni chos la dbang ba'o //
translated: The power of Dharma is the attainment of whatever one wishes for in terms of the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters, and the skill in perfectly arranging all Dharmas.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba la srung ba med pa gsum ni gzhung nyid las go sla'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba la srung ba med pa gsum ni gzhung nyid las go sla'o //
translated: What are the three fearlessnesss of the Tathagata? The three fearlessnesss are easy to understand from the text itself.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: The three establishments of mindfulness are easy to understand because of the absence of attachment and aversion.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe ji ltar sems can gyi don mdzad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe ji ltar sems can gyi don mdzad pa de'i tshe /
translated: The nature of being without forgetfulness is that whenever and however the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin du sgrub pa ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin du sgrub pa ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: the Tathagata accomplishes it in just that way. This is the nature of being without forgetfulness.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs tshad mar 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par dgod do //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs tshad mar 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par dgod do //
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great being are set forth in order to generate faith in those who apprehend form as a measure.

original: de la rigs dang bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / 'jug pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / shes rab dang / thabs la sogs pa che bas skyes bu'i byed pa che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang /
analyzed: de la rigs dang bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / 'jug pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / shes rab dang / thabs la sogs pa che bas skyes bu'i byed pa che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang /
translated: They are called great beings because their deeds are great, since their lineage, intention, interest, aspiration, diligence, engagement, perfect accomplishment, wisdom, skillful means and so on are great.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la skyes bu chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la skyes bu chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Buddhas and great bodhisattvas are called great beings.

original: de dag skyes bu chen po yin pas 'di dag gis brjod cing mngon par bsal bar byed pa'i phyir skyes bu'i chen po'i mtshan rnams so //🔽'o na de dag gis @265a * //
analyzed: de dag skyes bu chen po yin pas 'di dag gis brjod cing mngon par bsal bar byed pa'i phyir skyes bu'i chen po'i mtshan rnams so // 'o na de dag gis @265a * //
translated: Since they are great beings, they are called the marks of a great being because they are expressed and manifested by them.

original: yan lag dang / nying lag rnams la skyes bu chen por mngon par byed pa gang la yang bye brag me pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag dang / nying lag rnams la skyes bu chen por mngon par byed pa gang la yang bye brag me pa'i phyir /
translated: But since there is no difference in the major and minor limbs of these beings,

original: 'di snyed cig go zhes bya bar mi rung bas sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba'i grangs don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyed cig go zhes bya bar mi rung bas sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba'i grangs don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it is not possible to say they are so many and the enumeration of thirty two is meaningless.

original: de yang bden mod kyi 'on kyang thos pa dang / dran pa dag las de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i don de lta bu'i grangs nges par bstan te /
analyzed: de yang bden mod kyi 'on kyang thos pa dang / dran pa dag las de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i don de lta bu'i grangs nges par bstan te /
translated: This is true, but the order of the ten powers is taught in accordance with the order of hearing and memory.

original: 'dir yang grangs 'di nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang grangs 'di nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: Here, the order is taught in accordance with the order of the epithets.

original: mtshan 'di rnams kyang mdor bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan 'di rnams kyang mdor bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: The epithets are taught by way of brief indication, explanation, cause, result, and aspect.

original: dang po ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the brief indication.

original: de'i 'og tu mtshan de rnams 'grel pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtshan de rnams 'grel pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of those epithets is the explanation.

original: sngon gyi las smos pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las smos pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The mention of former actions is the cause.

original: snga ltas smos pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: snga ltas smos pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The mention of the signs is the result.

original: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la 'khor lo ni 'jig rten na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la 'khor lo ni 'jig rten na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He has the mark of wheels on his hands and feet means that in the world there are two kinds of wheels:

original: mtshon cha'i 'khor lo dang / 'gro ba 'jug pa'i 'khor lo shing rta la sogs pa'i 'phang lo lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha'i 'khor lo dang / 'gro ba 'jug pa'i 'khor lo shing rta la sogs pa'i 'phang lo lta bu'o //
translated: weapons wheels and wheels that move beings, such as the wheels of a chariot.

original: de yang phyag dang zhabs gnyis ka la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang phyag dang zhabs gnyis ka la 'byung ngo //
translated: He has these on both his hands and feet.

original: 'di'i sngon gyi las kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di'i sngon gyi las kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The former actions of a Bodhisattva are also of two kinds:

original: bla ma la skyel zhing bsu ba'i grangs su gtogs pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: bla ma la skyel zhing bsu ba'i grangs su gtogs pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa ni gcig ste /
translated: One kind is included in the perfection of morality, and consists of such acts as welcoming and escorting teachers.

original: de'i 'bras bus 'gro bar 'jug pa'i 'khor lo zhabs kyi mthil du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bus 'gro bar 'jug pa'i 'khor lo zhabs kyi mthil du 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of that is the wheel which appears on the sole of his foot, and by which he enters the womb.

original: chos nyan pa dang / phreng ba rgyud pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten gyi gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog byin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa de'i 'bras bus phyag gi mthil gnyis su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos nyan pa dang / phreng ba rgyud pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten gyi gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog byin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa de'i 'bras bus phyag gi mthil gnyis su 'byung ngo //
translated: The other kind is included in the perfection of generosity, and consists of such acts as listening to the Dharma, making rosaries, going to temples and stupas, and giving service. The result of that is the wheel which appears on the palms of his hands.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan ba sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan ba sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It has a thousand spokes, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe de dag thams cad rnam pa thams gsum yongs su ma rdzogs pa de'i tshe ni mtshan de dag gis 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag thams cad rnam pa thams gsum yongs su ma rdzogs pa de'i tshe ni mtshan de dag gis 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he has not completed all the aspects of these actions, he becomes a universal monarch with those marks, and then goes forth.

original: de'i tshe ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
translated: At that time, one does not fully awaken to supreme enlightenment.

original: dper na rgyal po shang ka zhes bya la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po shang ka zhes bya la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the king called Śaṅkha and others.

original: gang gi tshe de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya @265b ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya @265b ste /
translated: When all of those are completely perfected in every way, at that time one fully awakens to supreme enlightenment.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa de na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa de na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that when all aspects are completely perfected.

original: de la med do sde gzhan dag las mtshan gzhan dang gzhan dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / sdong ris dang / bum pa gang ba dang nya sbrel ba dang rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang / khri bzang po dang / gdugs dkar po dang /
analyzed: de la med do sde gzhan dag las mtshan gzhan dang gzhan dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / sdong ris dang / bum pa gang ba dang nya sbrel ba dang rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang / khri bzang po dang / gdugs dkar po dang /
translated: In other sūtras, other marks such as the auspicious mark, the swastika, the endless knot, the vase filled with jewels, the pair of fish, the victory banner, the conch, the excellent throne, the white parasol,

original: rnga yab la sogs pa dag kyang ma bstan tam zhe na /
analyzed: rnga yab la sogs pa dag kyang ma bstan tam zhe na /
translated: the yak-tail fan, and so on are not taught.

original: de yang bden mod kyi gtso bor gyur pa 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa bstan na de dag kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bden mod kyi gtso bor gyur pa 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa bstan na de dag kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is true, but if the primary mark of the wheel is taught, those are also taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs gnyis la mi snang ba'i mtshan bzang po thams cad med pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs gnyis la mi snang ba'i mtshan bzang po thams cad med pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say: The two feet of the Tathagata are not devoid of all the excellent minor marks that are not visible.

original: mtshan gyis 'khor lo de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan gyis 'khor lo de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to include those wheels within the marks,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar bstan to zhes kha cig smra'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar bstan to zhes kha cig smra'o //
translated: it is said that they are complete in all aspects.

original: de ni g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang / sangs rgyas rnams thun mong ste /🔽'khor lo ni mu khyud nas bzung ste rtsibs dang ldan pa'i dbang gis g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba dang mthun no //
analyzed: de ni g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang / sangs rgyas rnams thun mong ste / 'khor lo ni mu khyud nas bzung ste rtsibs dang ldan pa'i dbang gis g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba dang mthun no //
translated: The statement that the feet are well-placed is because others are not like that.

original: zhabs shin tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan dag ni sa mi mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: zhabs shin tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan dag ni sa mi mnyam pa'am /
translated: The feet of others are not well-placed due to uneven ground,

original: rkang pa'i mthil mi mnyam pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'i dbang ngam /🔽rkang pa'i rtse mo'am /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil mi mnyam pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'i dbang ngam / rkang pa'i rtse mo'am /
translated: due to the power of engaging in attachment and so on,🔽due to the tips of the feet,

original: rkang ba'i zur gnyis sam /
analyzed: rkang ba'i zur gnyis sam /
translated: or due to the two sides of the feet.

original: rting pas sa la 'dzugs shing 'gro //
analyzed: rting pas sa la 'dzugs shing 'gro //
translated: He walks with the heels of his feet touching the ground evenly.

original: mchong zhing 'gro la dbus su yang skabs 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mchong zhing 'gro la dbus su yang skabs 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He walks with his body erect, and his gait is majestic.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not have such faults.

original: zhabs kyi mthil thams cad mnyam par sa la 'bab par gshegs pa dang mnyam par sa la reg pa la zhabs shin tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil thams cad mnyam par sa la 'bab par gshegs pa dang mnyam par sa la reg pa la zhabs shin tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They walk with their feet evenly placed on the ground, and their feet are well placed.

original: sa chen po thams cad kyang mthon dman dang / gseg ma dang / rdo ba dang / chu dang / 'dam rdzab dang / tsher ma dang / khung la sogs pa med par mnyam pas gnas shing /
analyzed: sa chen po thams cad kyang mthon dman dang / gseg ma dang / rdo ba dang / chu dang / 'dam rdzab dang / tsher ma dang / khung la sogs pa med par mnyam pas gnas shing /
translated: The entire great earth is even, without high and low, without pebbles, rocks, water, mud, thorns, holes, and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong du ma'i dbang gis /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong du ma'i dbang gis /
translated: By the power of many hundreds of thousands of worlds,

original: thag ring ba dag kyang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag ring ba dag kyang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: even the distant becomes near.

original: sngon gyi las bstan pa la /
analyzed: sngon gyi las bstan pa la /
translated: Regarding the teaching on past karma,

original: yi dam la brtan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang / gtong ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: yi dam la brtan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang / gtong ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang gis /
translated: “because of firmness in vows” means that through the power of the blessings of truth, generosity, peace, and wisdom,

original: rtsom @266a * //
analyzed: rtsom @266a * //
translated: Composition🔽

original: pa thams cad la sus kyang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa thams cad la sus kyang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The word all is used because no one can take away his compositions.

original: de ni mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni bdud dang / phyir rgol ba dang / mu stegs can la sogs pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni bdud dang / phyir rgol ba dang / mu stegs can la sogs pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'o //
translated: This is the sign of his unshakability, meaning that he is unshaken by all the demons, adversaries, and tirthikas.

original: phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni phyag gi sor mo'i tshigs dang po nas phyag sor gyi bar phra seng seng po med pa /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni phyag gi sor mo'i tshigs dang po nas phyag sor gyi bar phra seng seng po med pa /
translated: His hands and feet are networked, meaning that there are no gaps between the fingers and toes of his hands and feet.

original: sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan kyang gzhug tu rung ba ste /
analyzed: sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan kyang gzhug tu rung ba ste /
translated: He is suitable to wear finger rings and other ornaments.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa'i dra bas 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa'i dra bas 'brel ba'o //
translated: He is networked with beauty in every way.

original: sngon gyi las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag kun du bsten pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pas bsdu ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni phyag gnyis dra ba can du gyur to //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag kun du bsten pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pas bsdu ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni phyag gnyis dra ba can du gyur to //
translated: He is endowed with the four means of gathering disciples because he has practiced generosity and the other three means of gathering disciples.

original: de las gzhan pa don spyod pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni zhabs gnyis dra ba can du gyur to zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa don spyod pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni zhabs gnyis dra ba can du gyur to zhes 'chad do //
translated: The other two feet are webbed because of his other two perfections, i.e., of generosity and morality.

original: yang na phyag gnyis kyis ni sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na phyag gnyis kyis ni sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, he attracts beings with his two hands;🔽and, once attracted, they come to rest on his two feet.🔽His fingers and toes are rounded,

original: bsdus pa'i sems can rnams kyis zhabs gtugs pa las gyur to //🔽sor mo'i rnam pa seng seng po med pa zhes bya bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i sems can rnams kyis zhabs gtugs pa las gyur to // sor mo'i rnam pa seng seng po med pa zhes bya bar gzung ngo //
translated: because he is in harmony with the four means of conversion, which attract beings.🔽He is well-proportioned, because his retinue is well-proportioned.

original: legs par sdud cing 'jam par gyur pa'i phyir 'di dag bsdu ba'i dngos po dang mthun no //🔽myur du 'du ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor brgyad chos bshad pa la myur du 'du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs par sdud cing 'jam par gyur pa'i phyir 'di dag bsdu ba'i dngos po dang mthun no // myur du 'du ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor brgyad chos bshad pa la myur du 'du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is well-proportioned, because his retinue is well-proportioned.

original: kha cig ni phyag dang / zhabs dra bas 'brel ba la gzhan du 'chad de /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phyag mthe bo gnyis ma gtogs par /
analyzed: kha cig ni phyag dang / zhabs dra bas 'brel ba la gzhan du 'chad de / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phyag mthe bo gnyis ma gtogs par /
translated: Some explain the expression “having hands and feet with a network” in a different way:🔽The Blessed Buddhas have fingers and toes that are connected by a web,

original: sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo mnyam pa yin te /
translated: but not thumbs.

original: sor mo dag kyang nas dang nas su 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid can la /
analyzed: sor mo dag kyang nas dang nas su 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid can la /
translated: The fingers and toes are connected by webs,

original: mnyam par gnas te /🔽skar khung gi dra ba dang / ka ba'i rtse mo mnyam pa bzhin du sor mo thams cad la /
analyzed: mnyam par gnas te / skar khung gi dra ba dang / ka ba'i rtse mo mnyam pa bzhin du sor mo thams cad la /
translated: and are equal in length.🔽All the fingers and toes are equal in length,

original: nas kyi mtshan thams cad mnyam par snang zhing /
analyzed: nas kyi mtshan thams cad mnyam par snang zhing /
translated: and appear like the openings of a window or the tops of pillars.

original: dra ba bzhin du snang ba'i phyir phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: dra ba bzhin du snang ba'i phyir phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba zhes 'chad do //
translated: Because they appear like a net, the hands and feet are said to be “connected by webs.”

original: sems can phra mo dag / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs gnyis kyis reg na shin tu bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can phra mo dag / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs gnyis kyis reg na shin tu bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the tiny sentient beings touch the two feet of the Tathāgata, they experience great bliss.

original: shi 'phos na yang lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi 'phos na yang lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they die, they are reborn in a god realm.

original: zhabs dra ba can gyi mtshan de la mthu de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhabs dra ba can gyi mtshan de la mthu de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: It is said that the mark of having webbed hands and feet has such power.

original: phyag dang zhabs 'jam shing gzhon sha chags @266b pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'jam shing gzhon sha chags @266b pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hands and feet are soft and youthful.

original: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa'o //
translated: “Soft” means supple.

original: gzhon sha chags pa ni mdog phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhon sha chags pa ni mdog phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Youthful” means having an excellent complexion.

original: bdun mtho ba zhes bya ba ni phyag dang zhabs kyi bol gnyis dang / dpung mgo gnyis dang ltag pa ste /
analyzed: bdun mtho ba zhes bya ba ni phyag dang zhabs kyi bol gnyis dang / dpung mgo gnyis dang ltag pa ste /
translated: The seven elevated parts are the two hands, the two feet, the two shoulders, and the nape of the neck.

original: de dag shas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are elevated because they are well-rounded.

original: sngon gyi las ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldags pa dang / bca' ba gya nom pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa byin pas phyag dang / zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldags pa dang / bca' ba gya nom pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa byin pas phyag dang / zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: His hands and feet are soft and youthful because he gave excellent food and drink, and because he gave food and drink in a timely way.

original: bza' ba'i dngos po mang du byin pas ni bdun mtho bar gyur to //🔽yang na zhabs gnyis kyis gshegs nas /
analyzed: bza' ba'i dngos po mang du byin pas ni bdun mtho bar gyur to // yang na zhabs gnyis kyis gshegs nas /
translated: He has seven elevated parts because he gave abundant food.

original: phyag gnyis kyis byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, he has seven elevated parts because he gave with both hands and feet.

original: yang na phyag gnyis kyis byin nas sems can rnams bdag gi zhabs la gzhol bar byas pa'i phyir phyag dang zhabs gnyis de lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: yang na phyag gnyis kyis byin nas sems can rnams bdag gi zhabs la gzhol bar byas pa'i phyir phyag dang zhabs gnyis de lta bur gyur to //
translated: Or, he has both hands and feet because he gave with both hands and feet and caused sentient beings to bow at his feet.

original: bdun mtho ba ni khams bdun tshim par byas pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun mtho ba ni khams bdun tshim par byas pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has seven elevated parts because he satisfied the seven constituents of the body.

original: las gcig gis mtshan gnyis 'byung bar ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: las gcig gis mtshan gnyis 'byung bar ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do we know that two marks arise from one karma?

original: las gcig yin du zin kyang shin tu cher byas shing bstsags pas mtshan gnyis sam gsum yang 'grub par 'gyur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: las gcig yin du zin kyang shin tu cher byas shing bstsags pas mtshan gnyis sam gsum yang 'grub par 'gyur zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that even though one karma exists, two or three marks are produced because it is done and accumulated to a high degree.

original: sor mo ring ba zhes bya ba ni ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang thung ba dang / ha cang sbom pa dang / ha cang phra ba dang yo ba la sogs pa sor mo'i skyon rnams spangs shing skyon med la /
analyzed: sor mo ring ba zhes bya ba ni ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang thung ba dang / ha cang sbom pa dang / ha cang phra ba dang yo ba la sogs pa sor mo'i skyon rnams spangs shing skyon med la /
translated: Long fingers: The fingers are not too long, not too short, not too thick, not too thin, not crooked, and so on. The fingers are free of faults and are without faults.

original: phyag gi mthil dang 'tsham pa /
analyzed: phyag gi mthil dang 'tsham pa /
translated: They are suitable for the palms of the hands.

original: tshad dang ldan pa sor mo mthar gyis shas rgyas te /
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa sor mo mthar gyis shas rgyas te /
translated: They are proportionate. The fingers are gradually thicker and

original: rtse mo phra ba gang yin pa de la sor mo ring ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo phra ba gang yin pa de la sor mo ring ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the tips are fine. This is called “long fingers.”

original: rting pa'i skyon thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: rting pa'i skyon thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: The soles of the feet are free of all faults.

original: tshad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa /
translated: They are proportionate.

original: zhabs dang 'tsham pa'i rting pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhabs dang 'tsham pa'i rting pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the soles of the feet are suitable for the feet,

original: rting pa yangs pa ste /
analyzed: rting pa yangs pa ste /
translated: the soles of the feet are broad.

original: de la zhabs kyi mthil thams cad la cha bzhir byas pa las /
analyzed: de la zhabs kyi mthil thams cad la cha bzhir byas pa las /
translated: The soles of his feet are divided into four parts.

original: cha gsum ni zhabs /
analyzed: cha gsum ni zhabs /
translated: Three parts are the feet.🔽One part is the heel.

original: cha gcig ni rting par gyur na tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cha gcig ni rting par gyur na tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the measure.

original: chu zheng gab pa phun sum tshogs pa dang phang mtho ba'i phyir sku che ba'o //🔽mi gzhan ltar phrag pa dang / rked pa dang pus mo rnams las gang yang rung ba'am /
analyzed: chu zheng gab pa phun sum tshogs pa dang phang mtho ba'i phyir sku che ba'o // mi gzhan ltar phrag pa dang / rked pa dang pus mo rnams las gang yang rung ba'am /
translated: His body is large because it is well-proportioned in height and breadth, and because his chest is full.

original: mdun dang rgyab dang glo gye gu dang ya yo med pa'i phyir sku drang ba'o //🔽sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa zhes bya ba 'di la ring ba dang yangs pa'i sgra ni ran pa dang rkyen du @267a * //
analyzed: mdun dang rgyab dang glo gye gu dang ya yo med pa'i phyir sku drang ba'o // sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa zhes bya ba 'di la ring ba dang yangs pa'i sgra ni ran pa dang rkyen du @267a * //
translated: His body is straight because it is not bent or crooked like other men, either in the shoulders, the waist, or the knees.🔽His fingers and toes are long and his heels are broad.

original: bab pa'i tshig yin gyi /
analyzed: bab pa'i tshig yin gyi /
translated: Here the words long and broad are used in the sense of well-proportioned and well-developed.

original: ha cang ring ba dang ha cang yangs pa'i sgra ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ha cang ring ba dang ha cang yangs pa'i sgra ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not mean very long or very broad.

original: sngon gyi las bshad pa yang /
analyzed: sngon gyi las bshad pa yang /
translated: The explanation of his previous actions

original: gsad pa las thar par byas pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pas srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pa kun tu bsten pas zhes bya ba 'di la yang gsad par gyur pa'i mi rnams tshe thung ba las thar par byas pas tshe tha mal par gnas kyi /
analyzed: gsad pa las thar par byas pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pas srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pa kun tu bsten pas zhes bya ba 'di la yang gsad par gyur pa'i mi rnams tshe thung ba las thar par byas pas tshe tha mal par gnas kyi /
translated: And by relying on the avoidance of killing, one helps those who are about to be killed to escape from a short life.

original: glo bur du tshe ring bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur du tshe ring bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not make their life span longer than normal.

original: de bzhin du 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams byin pas kyang tshe thung ba med par byas pa yin gyi glo bur du tshe ring du byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams byin pas kyang tshe thung ba med par byas pa yin gyi glo bur du tshe ring du byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, by giving the necessities of life, one helps those who are about to die to escape from a short life, but it does not make their life span longer than normal.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rting pa dang / sor mo dag thung ba med pa nyid ring ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rting pa dang / sor mo dag thung ba med pa nyid ring ba yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, here, the absence of short heels and toes is long heels and toes,

original: lhag par ring ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag par ring ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not exceptionally long.

original: khru bdun du 'phags par mtho ba zhes bya ba ni mi tha mal pa'i lus pas 'phags par mtho ba ste /
analyzed: khru bdun du 'phags par mtho ba zhes bya ba ni mi tha mal pa'i lus pas 'phags par mtho ba ste /
translated: Seven cubits means that the body is taller than the body of an ordinary human being.

original: sku tha mal pa'i tshad la bya'o //
analyzed: sku tha mal pa'i tshad la bya'o //
translated: This is the measure of an ordinary body.

original: spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku'i tshad nges par bya mi nus so //
analyzed: spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku'i tshad nges par bya mi nus so //
translated: Since the crown of his head is invisible, one cannot determine the size of the Blessed One’s body.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pas lus kyi las mi drang ba med pa'i phyir sku drang po dang mthun no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pas lus kyi las mi drang ba med pa'i phyir sku drang po dang mthun no //
translated: His body is straight because he has abandoned killing and is without crooked bodily actions.

original: zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa zhes bya ba ni pus mo'i tshigs dang / long mo'i tshigs kyi rus pa mtho ba la 'bar 'bur can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa zhes bya ba ni pus mo'i tshigs dang / long mo'i tshigs kyi rus pa mtho ba la 'bar 'bur can zhes bya ste /
translated: His feet are without protuberances means that the bones of the ankles and knees are not prominent.

original: de med cing shin tu mngon la rab tu nub pa gang yin pa de la zhab 'bar 'bur med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de med cing shin tu mngon la rab tu nub pa gang yin pa de la zhab 'bar 'bur med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not so, but is very evident and well-set, is called “without protuberances.”

original: gzhan dag gi ni rus pa de gnyis che bas rkang pa dang / byin pa mi sdug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ni rus pa de gnyis che bas rkang pa dang / byin pa mi sdug pa yin no //
translated: In others, those two bones are large and the feet and calves are ugly.

original: mi mnyen pas 'gro na mi bde ste 'gros mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mnyen pas 'gro na mi bde ste 'gros mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are not flexible, it is uncomfortable to walk and the gait is ugly.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi tshigs mi mngon pas byin pa mdzes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi tshigs mi mngon pas byin pa mdzes so //
translated: The Blessed One’s ankles are not visible, so his calves are beautiful.

original: mnyen pas 'gros sdug pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyen pas 'gros sdug pa yin no //
translated: Because they are flexible, his gait is beautiful.

original: gzhan dag na re mi phal rnams kyi long bu'i rus pa ni rkang pa'i rgyab logs su 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mi phal rnams kyi long bu'i rus pa ni rkang pa'i rgyab logs su 'byung ste /
translated: Other teachers say: The ankle bones of ordinary people protrude on the back of the foot.

original: de bas na de dag gi rkang pa gzer btab pa 'dra la /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi rkang pa gzer btab pa 'dra la /
translated: Therefore, their feet are like they have been pierced by a nail.

original: mi mnyen pas ci bder bsgyur du mi rung la 'gro ba na yang rkang pa'i mthil mi snang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi mnyen pas ci bder bsgyur du mi rung la 'gro ba na yang rkang pa'i mthil mi snang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: They are not flexible and cannot be bent as desired. When walking, the soles of their feet do not appear.

original: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi long mo'i rus pa ni zhabs kyi gong bas mtho ba'i phyogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi long mo'i rus pa ni zhabs kyi gong bas mtho ba'i phyogs su 'byung ngo //
translated: The ankle bones of great beings protrude on the upper part of the foot.

original: de dag gi sku yang ro smad 'ba' zhig g-yo'i /
analyzed: de dag gi sku yang ro smad 'ba' zhig g-yo'i /
translated: Their bodies move only from the lower part of the body.

original: ro stod @267b g-yo bar mi mngon no //🔽zhabs kyang bde blag tu bsgyur du rung la /
analyzed: ro stod @267b g-yo bar mi mngon no // zhabs kyang bde blag tu bsgyur du rung la /
translated: The upper part of the body does not appear to move.🔽The feet are flexible and can be bent as desired.

original: mdun rgyab dang / g-yas g-yos su 'dug ste bltas kyang zhabs kyi mthil snang zhing 'gros sdug go //
analyzed: mdun rgyab dang / g-yas g-yos su 'dug ste bltas kyang zhabs kyi mthil snang zhing 'gros sdug go //
translated: When walking, the soles of the feet appear and the gait is beautiful.

original: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po rnams kyi sku'i spu rnams spu'i khung bu nas skye ba na /
analyzed: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po rnams kyi sku'i spu rnams spu'i khung bu nas skye ba na /
translated: The body hair points upward. The body hair of great beings grows from the pores of the skin.

original: zhal bzang po la gyen du lta ba 'dra bar rtse mo gyen du lta zhing skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhal bzang po la gyen du lta ba 'dra bar rtse mo gyen du lta zhing skye ba'o //
translated: The tips of the toes point upward, as if looking up at the face of the Buddha.

original: sngon gyi las kyang dge ba'i chos blangs pa rnams ji ltar gong nas gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhabs kyi phyogs mtho ba dang / spu kha gyen du lta zhing mthon por 'byung ba dang mthun no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang dge ba'i chos blangs pa rnams ji ltar gong nas gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhabs kyi phyogs mtho ba dang / spu kha gyen du lta zhing mthon por 'byung ba dang mthun no //
translated: The feet are elevated, and the hairs on the feet point upward, in keeping with the fact that past actions and the virtues one has taken up increase more and more.

original: byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu zhes bya ba ni ri dags ae na ya'i byin pa dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de la ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu zhes bya ba ni ri dags ae na ya'i byin pa dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de la ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The calves are like those of the eṇeya antelope. The calves are like the calves of the eṇeya antelope.

original: mi phal gyi byin pa ni phyogs gcig tu sha rlo bor gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mi phal gyi byin pa ni phyogs gcig tu sha rlo bor gyur pa'am /
translated: The calves of most people are flabby on one side,

original: yo ba'am / ha cang sbom pa'am /
analyzed: yo ba'am / ha cang sbom pa'am /
translated: crooked, too thick,

original: ha cang ring ba'am thung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ha cang ring ba'am thung ba yin gyi /
translated: too long, or too short.

original: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi ni sha mkhregs la byin gyis phra zhing dbyibs snyoms pa dang / shin tu zlum zhing chu zheng gab pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi ni sha mkhregs la byin gyis phra zhing dbyibs snyoms pa dang / shin tu zlum zhing chu zheng gab pa ste /
translated: But the calves of great beings are firm, with slender calves and a symmetrical shape, very round, and the width and length are in proportion.

original: sor bco brgyad tsam gyi phyogs na yod do //
analyzed: sor bco brgyad tsam gyi phyogs na yod do //
translated: The fingers are eighteen finger-widths long.🔽The disciples increased and flourished because he respectfully gave them the crafts, the arts, and the sciences.

original: sngon gyi las kyang bzo'i las dang rig pa'i gnas rnams gus par byas shing byin pas slob ma de rnams 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur pa dang / yo byad rnams byin pas de dag stobs dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang bzo'i las dang rig pa'i gnas rnams gus par byas shing byin pas slob ma de rnams 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur pa dang / yo byad rnams byin pas de dag stobs dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: He gave them the necessities of life, so they became strong.

original: de dang mthun par sha skyes pa'i phyir byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de dang mthun par sha skyes pa'i phyir byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bur gyur to //
translated: Because he gave them food in accordance with their needs, he acquired the mark of having calves like an antelope.

original: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po de sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad myur du 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po de sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad myur du 'dzin cing /
translated: This is an omen that he will quickly grasp the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sems can thams cad kyis zhus pa'i rgyun rnams skad cig gcig gis 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sems can thams cad kyis zhus pa'i rgyun rnams skad cig gcig gis 'dzin to //
translated: The Tathāgata also grasps the stream of questions from all sentient beings in a single instant.

original: phyag sbom zhing ring ba zhes bya ba la /🔽sbom pa ni sbom lag che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag sbom zhing ring ba zhes bya ba la / sbom pa ni sbom lag che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His hands are long and webbed.

original: ring ba ni pus mor slebs pa'i phyir khrun ring ba'o //
analyzed: ring ba ni pus mor slebs pa'i phyir khrun ring ba'o //
translated: They are long because they reach below the knees.

original: sngon gyi las kyang phyag brkyang ste ring du byas nas gzhan la sbyin pa byin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos rgya che ba'i phyir mthun no //🔽mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang phyag brkyang ste ring du byas nas gzhan la sbyin pa byin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos rgya che ba'i phyir mthun no // mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: because he previously gave gifts of fearlessness.🔽His body is well formed,🔽because he previously gave gifts of all kinds of things.🔽His body is smooth,

original: mdoms kyi sba ba ni mdoms su sba ba yin pas mdoms kyi sba ba ste /
analyzed: mdoms kyi sba ba ni mdoms su sba ba yin pas mdoms kyi sba ba ste /
translated: because he previously gave gifts of ornaments.🔽His body has seven convex surfaces,🔽because he previously gave gifts of dwellings.🔽His limbs are well rounded,🔽because he previously gave gifts of vehicles.

original: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub cing /🔽mi mngon pa gang yin pa de la mdoms kyi @268a * //
analyzed: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub cing / mi mngon pa gang yin pa de la mdoms kyi @268a * //
translated: His hands and feet are soft and tender,🔽because he previously gave gifts of servants.

original: sba ba sbubs su nub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sba ba sbubs su nub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: His hands and feet are net-like,🔽because he previously gave gifts of wealth.🔽His ankles are not prominent,🔽because he previously gave gifts of wives.🔽His legs are like the antelope,

original: gser gyi pad ma'i snying po sbubs su nub pa 'dra bar mdoms kyi sba ba'i phyogs sbubs kyi nang du mi mngon par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gser gyi pad ma'i snying po sbubs su nub pa 'dra bar mdoms kyi sba ba'i phyogs sbubs kyi nang du mi mngon par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because he previously gave gifts of male and female servants.🔽His body is large and straight,🔽because he previously gave gifts of food and drink.🔽His sexual organ is concealed in a sheath,🔽because he previously gave gifts of reconciliation and did not divide friends and relatives.🔽His body is well rounded and full,

original: sngon gyi las kyang mdza' bshes dang gnyen 'dab la sogs pa 'dum par byas pa dang / ma phye ba'i phyir sbubs dang sba ba dag de ltar mthun par gyur to //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang mdza' bshes dang gnyen 'dab la sogs pa 'dum par byas pa dang / ma phye ba'i phyir sbubs dang sba ba dag de ltar mthun par gyur to //
translated: because he previously gave gifts of protection to those in fear.🔽His body is well proportioned,🔽because he previously gave gifts of fearlessness.🔽His body is well formed,🔽because he previously gave gifts of all kinds of things.🔽His body is smooth,🔽because he previously gave gifts of ornaments.🔽His body has seven convex surfaces,🔽because he previously gave gifts of dwellings.🔽His limbs are well rounded,🔽because he previously gave gifts of vehicles.🔽His hands and feet are soft and tender,🔽because he previously gave gifts of servants.🔽His hands and feet are net-like,🔽because he previously gave gifts of wealth.🔽His ankles are not prominent,🔽because he previously gave gifts of wives.🔽His legs are like the antelope,🔽because he previously gave gifts of male and female servants.🔽His body is large and straight,🔽because he previously gave gifts of food and drink.

original: gsang thub par byas pas sba ba'i phyogs mi mngon par gyur te mthun no //
analyzed: gsang thub par byas pas sba ba'i phyogs mi mngon par gyur te mthun no //
translated: By keeping it secret, the side of concealment becomes invisible and is in harmony.

original: mdog gser 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni sku mkhregs shing snum la kha dog rab tu gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: mdog gser 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni sku mkhregs shing snum la kha dog rab tu gsal bar bstan to //
translated: By having a golden complexion, he shows that the body is firm, glossy, and has a very clear color.

original: pags pa srab ces bya ba 'dis ni phyi dang nang gi rdul dang dri ma la sogs pas sku la gos pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: pags pa srab ces bya ba 'dis ni phyi dang nang gi rdul dang dri ma la sogs pas sku la gos pa med par bstan to //
translated: By having fine skin, he shows that the body is not soiled by external and internal dust, dirt, etc.

original: phyag dang zhabs bkru ba dang khrus bya ba la sogs pa ni der rim gro pa rnams bsod nams thob par bya ba dang / dus su bde bar bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi phyir mdzad do //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs bkru ba dang khrus bya ba la sogs pa ni der rim gro pa rnams bsod nams thob par bya ba dang / dus su bde bar bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi phyir mdzad do //
translated: Washing the hands and feet, bathing, etc. are done there for the sake of the attendants obtaining merit and for the sake of timely comfort, for the sake of conventional designation.

original: spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni spu'i khung bu gcig nas spu gcig kho na skye bas na spu re re skye ba'o //
analyzed: spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni spu'i khung bu gcig nas spu gcig kho na skye bas na spu re re skye ba'o //
translated: By each hair grows singly and curls to the right, he shows that each hair grows from each pore, so it is said each hair grows singly.

original: kyil kyil por 'khyil ba ni g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba ste /
analyzed: kyil kyil por 'khyil ba ni g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba ste /
translated: Curling to the right means curling to the right side.

original: rgyan gdub kor sprul 'khyil ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: rgyan gdub kor sprul 'khyil ba lta bu'am /
translated: It is like a bracelet, a wreath, or a coiled cintamani gem.

original: sbrul 'khyil ba'i zlum pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sbrul 'khyil ba'i zlum pa lta bu ste /
translated: The curl between the eyebrows is like a coiled earring or a coiled snake.

original: gnyis ka yang g-yas su 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang g-yas su 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Both are coiled to the right.

original: zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni smin mtshams kyi thig le'i gnas na spu mnyen zhing 'jam la kha dog dkar zhing snum pa /
analyzed: zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni smin mtshams kyi thig le'i gnas na spu mnyen zhing 'jam la kha dog dkar zhing snum pa /
translated: The mark of the ūrṇā hair on the face is a soft, smooth, white, shiny hair in the place of the forehead drop.

original: drangs na khru gang ngam khru do'am khru gsum la sogs pa'i srid du 'byung la slar btang na /
analyzed: drangs na khru gang ngam khru do'am khru gsum la sogs pa'i srid du 'byung la slar btang na /
translated: When pulled, it is one cubit, one and a half cubits, or three cubits in length.

original: g-yas su 'khyil ba rtse mo gyen du phyogs pa dang / shing tog skyu ru ra tsam la dngul gyi sgo nga 'dra ba gang gi zhal na mdzes par 'dug pa de la zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas su 'khyil ba rtse mo gyen du phyogs pa dang / shing tog skyu ru ra tsam la dngul gyi sgo nga 'dra ba gang gi zhal na mdzes par 'dug pa de la zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When released, it is coiled to the right, with the tip pointing upward, like a myrobalan fruit, like a silver egg, beautiful on the face. This is called the mark of the ūrṇā hair on the face.

original: mtshan 'di gnyis kyi sngon gyi las kyang /
analyzed: mtshan 'di gnyis kyi sngon gyi las kyang /
translated: The past karma for these two marks is as follows:

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pas ni spu re re bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pas ni spu re re bar gyur to //
translated: By abandoning worldly distractions, the hairs became single.

original: pha ma la sogs pa ji ltar rigs pa'i gnas su bkod pa dang / rim gro byas pa dang / sbyin pa byin pa dang / ma mgu bar ma byas pa la sogs pas g-yas su 'khyil zhing ring ba dang / dbyibs legs par gyur to //
analyzed: pha ma la sogs pa ji ltar rigs pa'i gnas su bkod pa dang / rim gro byas pa dang / sbyin pa byin pa dang / ma mgu bar ma byas pa la sogs pas g-yas su 'khyil zhing ring ba dang / dbyibs legs par gyur to //
translated: He is right-spiraled and tall because he placed his parents and so on in the proper stations, served them, gave them gifts, and did not displease them.

original: ro stod seng ge'i lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i ro stod seng ge'i ro stod 'dra ba'i phyir @268b seng ge'i ro stod lta bu ste brang gi dbyes yangs shing che la sha rgyas pas spangs shing che ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o
analyzed: ro stod seng ge'i lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i ro stod seng ge'i ro stod 'dra ba'i phyir @268b seng ge'i ro stod lta bu ste brang gi dbyes yangs shing che la sha rgyas pas spangs shing che ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o
translated: His torso is like a lion's means that his torso is like a lion's torso, because his chest is broad and large and his flesh is full, he is endowed with the fullness of abandonment and greatness.

original: // dpung mgo legs par grub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // dpung mgo legs par grub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: His shoulders are well developed means

original: legs pa'i sgra ni zlum pa la bya'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i sgra ni zlum pa la bya'o //
translated: the word 'well' refers to being round.

original: grub pa'i sgra ni mgul pa rtsa'i dra ba mi mngon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i sgra ni mgul pa rtsa'i dra ba mi mngon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The word 'developed' refers to the absence of the network of veins on his neck.

original: gser gyi bum pa'i mgul pa ltar yongs su zlum zhing shin tu mkhregs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gser gyi bum pa'i mgul pa ltar yongs su zlum zhing shin tu mkhregs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that he is completely round like the neck of a golden vase and very firm.

original: sngon gyi las kyang mi snyan par mi zer ba ni seng ge'i tshul dang 'dra ba dang / mgul mdzes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang mi snyan par mi zer ba ni seng ge'i tshul dang 'dra ba dang / mgul mdzes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Not speaking unpleasantly about others' past actions is the cause of having a lion-like jaw.

original: gzhan la mi smod pa ni seng ge ltar yangs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi smod pa ni seng ge ltar yangs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Not criticizing others is the cause of having a broad jaw like a lion.

original: snyan par smra ba dang / legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / seng ge'i sgra dang mthun par smra ba ni lkog ma mdzes pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / seng ge'i sgra dang mthun par smra ba ni lkog ma mdzes pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Pleasant speech, speaking well, and speaking in a way that accords with the lion's roar are the causes of having a beautiful neck.

original: thal gong rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni thal gong rgyas shing yangs pa'o //
analyzed: thal gong rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni thal gong rgyas shing yangs pa'o //
translated: Having broad shoulders means having broad and expansive shoulders.

original: ro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ro drug po dag gi ro bro ba mkhyen pa la ro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya'o ;🔽/ skabs 'dir mkhyen pa ni dga' ba la bya ste /
analyzed: ro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ro drug po dag gi ro bro ba mkhyen pa la ro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya'o ; / skabs 'dir mkhyen pa ni dga' ba la bya ste /
translated: Knowing tastes means knowing the tastes of the six tastes. Here, knowing refers to delight.

original: phar 'dzin mar 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: phar 'dzin mar 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Like respecting one's father, and so on.

original: ro rnams kyis dga' zhing tshim par gyur pa'i phyir ro bro ba shes pa zhes bya ste skyes bu chen po rnams kyis mid pa na ni ro tshor bar byed pa'i rtsa bdun stong gyen du lta ba yod do //
analyzed: ro rnams kyis dga' zhing tshim par gyur pa'i phyir ro bro ba shes pa zhes bya ste skyes bu chen po rnams kyis mid pa na ni ro tshor bar byed pa'i rtsa bdun stong gyen du lta ba yod do //
translated: When great beings swallow food, there are seven thousand taste-channels in the body that look upward.

original: tha na til gyi 'brum bu tsam zhig gsol na yang sku thams cad du khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na til gyi 'brum bu tsam zhig gsol na yang sku thams cad du khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when he eats as little as a sesame seed, it spreads throughout his body.

original: ro thams cad kyi zhal du bcug na /
analyzed: ro thams cad kyi zhal du bcug na /
translated: When he puts all tastes in his mouth,

original: bdud rtsi'i ro dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i ro dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: they become like the taste of nectar.

original: de ni mtshan gyi las so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan gyi las so //
translated: This is the function of the marks.

original: sngon gyi las dang mthun pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang mthun pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The concordance with former actions is easy to understand.

original: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig na re n+ya gro zhes bya ba ni ngan pa ste /
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig na re n+ya gro zhes bya ba ni ngan pa ste /
translated: As for the statement that he is “proportioned like a nyagrodha tree,” some say that nyagrodha means “bad,”

original: ro smad la bya'o //
analyzed: ro smad la bya'o //
translated: and refers to the lower part of the body.

original: ro dha zhes bya ba ni ro stod do //
analyzed: ro dha zhes bya ba ni ro stod do //
translated: Rodha means “upper part of the body.”

original: chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa la bya ste /
analyzed: chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa la bya ste /
translated: Proportioned means “in harmony,”

original: gang gi sku lte ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gang gi sku lte ba nas bzung ste /
translated: because from the navel upward

original: ro stod dang ro smad tshad mnyam par gyur pa de la n+ya gro dha ltar chung zheng gab pa zhes bya ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ro stod dang ro smad tshad mnyam par gyur pa de la n+ya gro dha ltar chung zheng gab pa zhes bya ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The upper and lower parts of the body are equal in size. This is called “the body is symmetrical like a banyan tree.

original: gzhan dag na re n+ya gro zhes bya ba ni sku'i dbu nas zhabs kyi bar gyi tshad la bya'o //🔽ro dha ni zheng la bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re n+ya gro zhes bya ba ni sku'i dbu nas zhabs kyi bar gyi tshad la bya'o // ro dha ni zheng la bya'o //
translated: Others say that the word nyagrodha refers to the height of the body from head to foot.🔽The word vitasti refers to the width.

original: chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba ni 'dom la bya ste /
analyzed: chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ba ni 'dom la bya ste /
translated: The word vitasti refers to a cubit.

original: de la gang gi sku'i chu zheng 'dom dang mnyam par gyur pa de la n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab ces @269a * //🔽bya'o zer ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi sku'i chu zheng 'dom dang mnyam par gyur pa de la n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab ces @269a * // bya'o zer ro //
translated: The body is symmetrical like a banyan tree when the width of the body is equal to a cubit.

original: gzhan dag ni shing n+ya gro dha zhes bya ba sdong po dang yal ga rnams chu zheng mnyam pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni shing n+ya gro dha zhes bya ba sdong po dang yal ga rnams chu zheng mnyam pa zhig yod de /
translated: Others say that the tree called nyagrodha has branches and trunk of equal width.

original: de dang 'dra bar skyes bu chen po rnams kyi sku thams cad kyang 'dom gyi tshad dang mnyam pa ni shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar skyes bu chen po rnams kyi sku thams cad kyang 'dom gyi tshad dang mnyam pa ni shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: The body of a great being is like that tree, with the entire body equal to a cubit in width. This is called “the body is symmetrical like a banyan tree.”

original: dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dbu ze'u ka bcings pa dang 'dra ba la bya ste /🔽gzhan dag gi mgo ni yongs su ma rgyas shing mtho dman can la /
analyzed: dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dbu ze'u ka bcings pa dang 'dra ba la bya ste / gzhan dag gi mgo ni yongs su ma rgyas shing mtho dman can la /
translated: The head is endowed with a crown protrusion means that the head is like a well-bound turban.

original: mi mnyam pa dag yod kyi /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dag yod kyi /
translated: The heads of others are not fully developed, uneven, and not symmetrical.

original: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi dbu ni gtsug tor bzhin du snyoms shing yongs su zlum pa dang / yongs su rdzogs shing dbyibs legs pa dang / legs par rgyas pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi dbu ni gtsug tor bzhin du snyoms shing yongs su zlum pa dang / yongs su rdzogs shing dbyibs legs pa dang / legs par rgyas pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: But the heads of great beings are symmetrical like a crown protrusion, fully round, fully developed, well-shaped, and well-formed.

original: gzhan dag na re mtshan 'di ni 'phral ba'i dbyes yongs su rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mtshan 'di ni 'phral ba'i dbyes yongs su rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others say that this mark indicates the full development of the forehead.

original: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi 'phral ba ni rna ba g-yas pa'i gong nas rna ba g-yon pa'i gong gi bar du sha'i dbyibs legs pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po rnams kyi 'phral ba ni rna ba g-yas pa'i gong nas rna ba g-yon pa'i gong gi bar du sha'i dbyibs legs pa /
translated: The forehead of great beings is a well-shaped piece of flesh between the right and left ears.

original: 'phral ba'i dbyes yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: 'phral ba'i dbyes yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: The forehead is fully developed.

original: rgyal po gser gyi gtsug tor bcings pa 'dra bar mdzes pa'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rgyal po gser gyi gtsug tor bcings pa 'dra bar mdzes pa'o zhes smra'o //
translated: It is beautiful like a golden crown worn by a king.

original: sngon gyi las kyang dge ba'i las byed pa thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba gtso bor gyur nas khor yug tu kun dga' ra ba dang ; 'dun khang dang / btung ba'i gnas la sogs pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyang dge ba'i las byed pa thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba gtso bor gyur nas khor yug tu kun dga' ra ba dang ; 'dun khang dang / btung ba'i gnas la sogs pa byas pa ste /
translated: He was the foremost of all those who performed virtuous actions in the past. He made parks, temples, drinking places, etc.

original: de'i phyir n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is like a banyan tree, covered with branches.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur nas /
translated: Because he was the foremost of the assembly,

original: ma zhum par mgo bstod de 'jig pa med par sbyor ba de'i phyir dbu gtsug tor can du gyur to //
analyzed: ma zhum par mgo bstod de 'jig pa med par sbyor ba de'i phyir dbu gtsug tor can du gyur to //
translated: he was not discouraged, but raised his head and applied himself without destruction. Therefore, he has a crown protrusion.

original: de bas na mnga' dbang chen po mnga' ba'i snga ltas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mnga' dbang chen po mnga' ba'i snga ltas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he is a sign of great sovereignty.

original: ljags ring zhing srab pa zhes bya ba ring ba ni che ba'am khrun ring ba'o //
analyzed: ljags ring zhing srab pa zhes bya ba ring ba ni che ba'am khrun ring ba'o //
translated: His tongue is long and slender. Long means large or long in extent.

original: srab pa ni mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: srab pa ni mnyen pa'o //
translated: Slender means flexible.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang mtshungs pa'am /
translated: Brahma's voice means it is like Brahma's voice,

original: dbyangs mchog yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbyangs mchog yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: or because it is the best voice.

original: bya ka la ping ka'i gsung zhes bya ba ni bya ku ra ba'i skad lta bu'o //
analyzed: bya ka la ping ka'i gsung zhes bya ba ni bya ku ra ba'i skad lta bu'o //
translated: The voice is like the voice of the kalaviṅka bird.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ma nya ba tshes bcu gnyis kyi shas 'dra bar 'gram pa'i mtha' sha mkhregs shing legs par zlum pa'i phyir 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ma nya ba tshes bcu gnyis kyi shas 'dra bar 'gram pa'i mtha' sha mkhregs shing legs par zlum pa'i phyir 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu'o //
translated: The cheeks are like those of a lion, because the edges of the cheeks are firm and well rounded, like the full moon of the twelfth day of the lunar month.

original: skar ma pa ba sangs pas kyang lhag *par 'od gsal zhing dkar @269b ba'i phyir tshems shin tu dkar ba'o //
analyzed: skar ma pa ba sangs pas kyang lhag *par 'od gsal zhing dkar @269b ba'i phyir tshems shin tu dkar ba'o //
translated: The teeth are very white, because they are whiter and more radiant than the stars.

original: mthon dman dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i phyir tshems mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mthon dman dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i phyir tshems mnyam pa'o //
translated: The teeth are even, because there is no unevenness or irregularity.

original: tshems kyi mtshams dod pa la sogs pa med cing sdug pa'i phyir tshems thags bzang ba'o //
analyzed: tshems kyi mtshams dod pa la sogs pa med cing sdug pa'i phyir tshems thags bzang ba'o //
translated: The teeth are well-aligned, because there are no gaps between the teeth and so forth.

original: mi gzhan dag gi so ni sum cu rtsa gnyis sam nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod kyi /
analyzed: mi gzhan dag gi so ni sum cu rtsa gnyis sam nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod kyi /
translated: Other people have thirty-two or twenty-eight teeth.

original: de las bzlog pa ni grangs bzhi bcu tshang ba'i phyir tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni grangs bzhi bcu tshang ba'i phyir tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba'o //
translated: The Buddha has forty teeth, because he has a complete set of forty teeth.

original: spyan mthon mthing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyan mthon mthing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eyes are deep blue.

original: spyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang gi 'bras bu snum zhing gnag pa ste /
analyzed: spyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang gi 'bras bu snum zhing gnag pa ste /
translated: The pupils of his eyes are glossy and dark.

original: 'bras bu nag po'i mtha' gnyis dkar la /
analyzed: 'bras bu nag po'i mtha' gnyis dkar la /
translated: The two ends of the dark pupils are white.

original: rdzi ma gnyis gnas pa'i skabs snum zhing mthing kar 'dug pa /
analyzed: rdzi ma gnyis gnas pa'i skabs snum zhing mthing kar 'dug pa /
translated: The two eyelashes are in their place, glossy and dark blue.

original: grva gnyis chung zad dmar ba /
analyzed: grva gnyis chung zad dmar ba /
translated: The two corners are slightly red.

original: rdzi ma dang spyan gyi bar gser gyi mdog lta bu ste /
analyzed: rdzi ma dang spyan gyi bar gser gyi mdog lta bu ste /
translated: The space between the eyelashes and the eyes is the color of gold.

original: de ltar dang ba rnam pa lnga dang ldan du zin gyis kyang spyan gyi dkyil gtso bo yin pa'i phyir spyan mthon mthing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dang ba rnam pa lnga dang ldan du zin gyis kyang spyan gyi dkyil gtso bo yin pa'i phyir spyan mthon mthing zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though he has these five kinds of clarity, because the center of the eyes is the most important, it is called “deep blue eyes.”

original: be'u 'brangs ma thag pa gzhon nu'i rdzi ma dang 'dra bar rdzi ma bla 'og gi mdog shin tu snum zhing ma 'dzings pa'i phyir ba'i rdzi ma lta bu'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu drug pa /🔽dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu zhes bya ba ni mtshan rnams rjes su 'byed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: be'u 'brangs ma thag pa gzhon nu'i rdzi ma dang 'dra bar rdzi ma bla 'og gi mdog shin tu snum zhing ma 'dzings pa'i phyir ba'i rdzi ma lta bu'o / // / bam po nyi shu drug pa / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu zhes bya ba ni mtshan rnams rjes su 'byed par byed pa'am /
translated: His eyelashes are like those of a young calf, very glossy and unentangled, the color of the upper and lower eyelashes.🔽The eighty minor marks are called “minor” because they are secondary to the major marks,

original: mtshan dang rjes su mthun par phye ste /
analyzed: mtshan dang rjes su mthun par phye ste /
translated: or because they are distinguished in accordance with the major marks.

original: skyes bu chen po yin par ston pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po yin par ston pa'am /
translated: It is called “excellent mark” because it shows that one is a great being,

original: rjes su mthun par mdzes par byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par mdzes par byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: or because it makes one beautiful in accordance with that.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu yin zhes bya bas dpe byad bzang po bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu yin zhes bya bas dpe byad bzang po bstan to //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have copper-colored nails.

original: 'du byed thams cad las dben pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad las dben pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: “Isolated from all compositional activity” is its natural outcome.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all the others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan pa rnams kyis btsud nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan pa rnams kyis btsud nas /
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva attracts beings with pleasant speech through those six perfections” means that having attracted them with pleasant speech,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sdud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sdud par byed pa ste /
translated: he attracts them with the six perfections.

original: de bas na snyan par smra bar bgrang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na snyan par smra bar bgrang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is counted as pleasant speech.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyis don spyad pas sems can rnams sdud do zhes bya ba ni don bya ba'i bsam pas de sngon du btang bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sdud pa ste /🔽de @270a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyis don spyad pas sems can rnams sdud do zhes bya ba ni don bya ba'i bsam pas de sngon du btang bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sdud pa ste / de @270a * //
translated: Thus, the six perfections attract sentient beings by means of the intention to perform the aims of others.

original: bzhin du phyi ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du phyi ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.🔽One should be skilled in the accomplishment of the single letter.

original: yi ge gcig mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge'i gzungs kyi sgo'i rim pas yi ge gcig gis mtshan ma med pa'i
analyzed: yi ge gcig mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge'i gzungs kyi sgo'i rim pas yi ge gcig gis mtshan ma med pa'i
translated: The letter A is the door of all dharmas because it is originally unborn.

original: ting nge 'dzin mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par bya ba'o //
translated: One should be skilled in the accomplishment of the signless samadhi by means of the single letter.🔽One should be skilled in the inclusion of all with the single letter.

original: yi ge gcig gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su gtogs par gyis shig ces bya ba ni 'grib pa dang ldan pas 'grib pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su gtogs par gyis shig ces bya ba ni 'grib pa dang ldan pas 'grib pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The inclusion of all with the single letter means that all are included in the single letter.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams yongs su 'gyur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams yongs su 'gyur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that conditioned things are subject to complete transformation.🔽Contemplate the inclusion of the forty-five letters in a single letter.

original: yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa aa zhes bya ba'i nang du yi ge thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa aa zhes bya ba'i nang du yi ge thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This means that you should contemplate the inclusion of all the letters in the letter A, which is the attainment of the concentration on non-production.🔽Contemplate the inclusion of a single letter in the forty-five letters.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin aa zhes bya ba nyid du sgoms shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig ces bya ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin aa zhes bya ba nyid du sgoms shig ces bya'o //
translated: This means that you should contemplate the concentration on the forty-five letters as being just the letter A.🔽Subhuti, all dharmas are emanations by way of the absence of letters.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa'i rnam pas sprul pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings brjod du med pa'i rnam pas bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa'i rnam pas sprul pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings brjod du med pa'i rnam pas bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are produced by way of the inexpressibility of the dharma-element.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsol te /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsol te /
translated: As for how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom that arises from maturation, and so on, he said this:

original: gal te rnam par smin pa las byung ba la spyod na rnam par smin pa las byung ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sems can rnams dang / chos rnams mi dmigs te mi snang na chos bshad pa ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa las byung ba la spyod na rnam par smin pa las byung ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sems can rnams dang / chos rnams mi dmigs te mi snang na chos bshad pa ji ltar 'byung /
translated: If they practice the perfection of wisdom that arises from maturation, then since that which arises from maturation is nonconceptual, sentient beings and phenomena are not observed, that is, do not appear. So how does the explanation of the Dharma occur?

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sbyor na ji ltar phyin ci log la sbyor bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sbyor na ji ltar phyin ci log la sbyor bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: If they apply themselves to the factors of enlightenment that do not exist, how do they not apply themselves to error?

original: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig la mngon par dgyes par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig la mngon par dgyes par mdzad nas /
translated: When he had asked this, the Lord said, Subhūti, it is so, it is so, and so on, and he delighted in his words.

original: de ltar chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong nas sems can rnams la chos ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor @270b sems can dang / chos rnams stong pa de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong nas sems can rnams la chos ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor @270b sems can dang / chos rnams stong pa de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: Subhūti, it is true that beings and dharmas are empty,

original: 'on kyang de dag stong pa nyid du sems can rnams kyis mi shes pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag stong pa nyid du sems can rnams kyis mi shes pas /
translated: but beings do not know that emptiness.

original: de shes par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos ston te chos ston pa na yang ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to zhes de skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de shes par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos ston te chos ston pa na yang ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to zhes de skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān teaches the Dharma so that they may know that, and when he teaches the Dharma, he teaches it in such a way that emptiness is not disturbed.

original: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sgrib pa rnams dang bral shing shin tu yongs su dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sgrib pa rnams dang bral shing shin tu yongs su dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He sees all dharmas as unobstructed. This means he sees them as free from the obscurations of imputation and as completely pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i dpe yang rjes su mthun par zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i dpe yang rjes su mthun par zad do //
translated: The example of the Tathāgata’s emanations is also consistent with this.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na chos nyid kyi gzugs kun brtags pas rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na chos nyid kyi gzugs kun brtags pas rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ma bcings pa'o //
translated: “Neither bound nor liberated” means that in the stage of impurity, the form of reality is not bound because it is naturally devoid of the imagined.

original: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na yang glo bur gyi rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na yang glo bur gyi rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba'o //
translated: And in the stage of purity, it is not liberated because there is no adventitious purification.

original: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma bcings pa nyid dang ma grol ba nyid ces bya ba yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma bcings pa nyid dang ma grol ba nyid ces bya ba yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: “The non-bound and non-liberatedness of form is not form” means that the non-boundness and non-liberatedness are the stage of the perfected.

original: de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the reality of the imagined form—this is the meaning.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: “Extremely pure” means by nature, this is the intention.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa la mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni mi brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa la mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni mi brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: “The non-existent does not stand in the non-existent” means that it does not rely on it.

original: dper na nam mkha' la nam mkha' mi gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la nam mkha' mi gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, space does not exist in space.

original: rang gi dngos po yang dngos po med pa la mi gnas te med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po yang dngos po med pa la mi gnas te med pa'i phyir /
translated: Nor does one’s own nature exist in nonexistence, because it does not exist.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rno ba mi gnas pa lta bu'o //🔽gzhan dag gi dngos po yang dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rno ba mi gnas pa lta bu'o // gzhan dag gi dngos po yang dngos po med pa'am /
translated: For example, sharpness does not exist in the horns of a rabbit, etc.🔽Nor does the nature of another exist in nonexistence,

original: rang gi dngos po la mi gnas te /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po la mi gnas te /
translated: or in one’s own nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po dang rang gi dngos po gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir ro //
