analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po dang rang gi dngos po gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both the nature of another and one’s own nature do not exist.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied in other cases as well.🔽Thus, these Bhagavān Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, the Pratyekabuddhas, and the Śrāvakas have realized this very reality of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di nyid rtogs te zhes bya bas ni thams cad kyang chos mngon @271a * //🔽par rtogs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di nyid rtogs te zhes bya bas ni thams cad kyang chos mngon @271a * //🔽par rtogs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that all of them have the same realization of the Abhidharma.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de las kyang mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'chad pa'i tshe de dag las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de las kyang mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'chad pa'i tshe de dag las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: And the reality of phenomena is not transgressed. This is not to be transgressed when teaching the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'da' ba med do //
translated: Subhuti, the Dharma-element is not transgressed.🔽The Reality-limit and the Suchness are not transgressed.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni 'da' ba med do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings ni chos kyi sku ste 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni 'da' ba med do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings ni chos kyi sku ste 'da' ba med do //
translated: The Dharma-element of the Lord Buddhas is the Dharma-body, and it is not transgressed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin nyid 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin nyid 'da' ba med do //
translated: The Suchness of the Bodhisattvas is not transgressed.🔽The Reality-limit of the Pratyekabuddhas and of the Sravakas is not transgressed.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'da' ba med do zhes bya bar bye brag tu phye ste gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'da' ba med do zhes bya bar bye brag tu phye ste gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood in detail.

original: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they have no intrinsic nature which could be transgressed. This means: they have no intrinsic nature which could be transgressed.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' las 'da' ba ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' las 'da' ba ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
translated: The Lord, if the dharma-dhātu, suchness, and the very limit of reality do not transcend, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'da' bar snang na /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'da' bar snang na /
translated: This is the question: since form, feeling, etc. are the nature of transformation, they appear to transcend.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ni 'da' ba yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ni 'da' ba yod kyi /
translated: Thus, form, etc. have transcendence,

original: chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la ni med na de'i tshe ci gzugs la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la tha dad pa yod dam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la ni med na de'i tshe ci gzugs la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la tha dad pa yod dam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: but the dharma-dhātu, etc. do not. At that time, is there a difference between form, etc. and the dharma-dhātu, etc.?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa gsum tha dad pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa gsum tha dad pa med par bstan to //
translated: Then, the Lord, with “No, Subhūti,” etc., taught that the three, form, feeling, etc., and the dharma-dhātu, etc. are not different.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te don dam pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni 'da' ba med do zhes bya ba'o //🔽de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs kyang gzhan ma lags /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te don dam pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni 'da' ba med do zhes bya ba'o // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs kyang gzhan ma lags /
translated: The meaning of that is this: “There is no transcendence of ultimate form, etc.”

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti asked the Lord, “Lord, if form is not one thing and the dharma-constituent another, etc.,

original: gal te gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa la tha dad pa med na /
translated: he asked this: “If form, feeling, etc., and the dharma-constituent, etc., are not different,

original: 'o na ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa bzhin du chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi @271b dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa bzhin du chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi @271b dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: then, just like the dharma-constituent, etc., all dharmas would be unconditioned, and there would be no way to set out the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: Then the Lord said to Subhūti, “Subhūti, I declare that, based on conventional truth, there are four results of the life of a monastic.”

original: chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although all phenomena are by nature unconditioned,

original: 'on kyang byis pa kun brtags pa'i spyod yul du byed pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa kun brtags pa'i spyod yul du byed pa rnams la /
translated: nevertheless, for the childish who take them as objects of imagination,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba kun brtags pa rnams yod de /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba kun brtags pa rnams yod de /
translated: there are the imagined virtues and nonvirtues.

original: de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa dkar po dang nag po yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa dkar po dang nag po yang yod do //
translated: And because of that, there are also the ripened results that are good and bad.

original: de'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du de dag bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du de dag bshad kyi /
translated: Because of that, the Lord taught them in terms of conventional truth,

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: but ultimately, since all phenomena are by nature suchness,🔽it is not possible to teach the arrangement of karma and its results.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because ultimately there is no conceptualization.

original: chos de ni rnam par mi rtog pa brjod du mi rung bas brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: chos de ni rnam par mi rtog pa brjod du mi rung bas brjod du med pa ste /
translated: That phenomenon is nonconceptual and inexpressible, and so it is inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar ming dang gzugs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs kyi chos rnams kyi nang nas ming zhes bya ba dang /🔽gzugs zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming dang gzugs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs kyi chos rnams kyi nang nas ming zhes bya ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The terms “name” and “form” refer to the formless and the form dharmas, respectively.🔽This is the conventional truth.

original: don dam par de bzhin nyid de ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin nyid de ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, suchness is non-conceptual because it is the perfected nature.

original: brjod du med pa'i phyir brjod du mi rung ba'o //🔽'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i phyir brjod du mi rung ba'o // 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is inexpressible because it is inexpressible.🔽It is non-arising because it is unconditioned.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir 'gag pa med pa'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir 'gag pa med pa'o // rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-ceasing because it is non-arising.🔽It is unafflicted because it is naturally isolated.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is unpurified because it is naturally pure.

original: 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis su brjod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis su brjod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that those very non-conceptualizations and so forth are described as two kinds of emptiness.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa mchis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa mchis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
translated: Bhagavan, if the establishment of the result is due to the conventional truth, and so on, he asked this:

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin par 'bras @272a * //🔽bu rnam par dgod par bya na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin par 'bras @272a * // bu rnam par dgod par bya na /
translated: If the establishment of the result is not real,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par ci'i phyir rnam par mi dgod ces bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par ci'i phyir rnam par mi dgod ces bya'o //
translated: why is it that foolish ordinary beings and so on are not established in the result of stream entry and so on?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said:

original: rab 'byor ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, do foolish ordinary beings know the conventional truth or not?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te /
translated: The Buddha said, Do you understand ultimate truth?

original: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med du zin kyang kun brtags pa rnams yongs su shes pa nyid kyi phyir kun brtags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par dgod pa yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med du zin kyang kun brtags pa rnams yongs su shes pa nyid kyi phyir kun brtags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par dgod pa yod do //
translated: Even though the establishment of the fruits is not possible, the establishment of the fruits of stream-entry, etc., is possible because of the complete understanding of the imagined.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la ni de yongs su shes pa med de /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la ni de yongs su shes pa med de /
translated: But for the childish, the ordinary persons, there is no complete understanding of that.

original: de'i phyir lam sgom pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam sgom pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, they do not cultivate the path.

original: de bas na de dag la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa yang mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the fruits is not for them.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni yongs su shes pa yod pas de'i phyir de dag nyid la lam dang lam ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni yongs su shes pa yod pas de'i phyir de dag nyid la lam dang lam ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dgod par bya'o //
translated: But for the noble persons, there is complete understanding, therefore, the establishment of the path, the non-path, and the fruits is for them alone.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: The elder Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags lam la bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci lam bsgoms pa'i rgyus 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags lam la bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci lam bsgoms pa'i rgyus 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: The Blessed One, what is the case?🔽 Does the fruit arise by the cause of cultivating the path?

original: 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ram zhes de skad zhus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ram zhes de skad zhus te /
translated: Does one attain the fruit?

original: de ltar gyur na de yang don dam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de yang don dam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: If that is the case, then that would be ultimate reality itself.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, that is not the case.

original: lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The fruit does not arise by cultivating the path,

original: 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the fruit is not attained.

original: lam dang 'bras bu gnyis ka yang kun brtags pa yin pas bsal ba bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu gnyis ka yang kun brtags pa yin pas bsal ba bka' stsal to //
translated: This is the refutation, because both the path and the fruit are imagined.

original: rab 'byor lam ma bsgoms pas kyang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa yin du zin kyang nges pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor lam ma bsgoms pas kyang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa yin du zin kyang nges pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the fruit is not attained without cultivating the path, this is the teaching of certainty, even if it is imagined.

original: lam gyis 'bras bu thob par bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: lam gyis 'bras bu thob par bya ba yang med do //
translated: The fruit is not to be attained by the path.

original: lam ma yin pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lam ma yin pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: Nor is it attained by a non-path.🔽Nor is it in the path.

original: lam la yod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos nges par gyur pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lam la yod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos nges par gyur pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the certainty of the Dharma.🔽The result is not established in the realm of phenomena by way of division.

original: chos kyi dbyings la char bcad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la de @272b ltar cha shas su bcad de rnam par dgod pa don dam par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag la char bcad pa ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la char bcad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la de @272b ltar cha shas su bcad de rnam par dgod pa don dam par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bcom ldan 'das gal te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag la char bcad pa ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
translated: This means that such a division and establishment of parts in the realm of phenomena does not exist ultimately.🔽The Elder asked this:

original: ci'i phyir spong ba dang / lam dang / 'bras bu dag ris su bcad de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spong ba dang / lam dang / 'bras bu dag ris su bcad de /
translated: Blessed One, if the compounded and uncompounded realms are not divided, why are the abandonments, paths, and results divided?

original: rnam par dgod par byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dgod par byas zhes bya'o //
translated: This means, Why are they established as separate?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:🔽Elder, the compounded and uncompounded realms are not divided.

original: rab 'byor ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te /
analyzed: rab 'byor ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te /
translated: Subhuti: What is the fruit of a Streamwinner? etc.

original: de dag la ni don dam par yongs su shes pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa'i rim pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag la ni don dam par yongs su shes pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa'i rim pa med pa nyid de /
translated: In them there is no ultimate process of full understanding or penetration.

original: 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Because those fruits of a Streamwinner, etc. are unconditioned.

original: de dag la rim par dbye ba nyid med do //
analyzed: de dag la rim par dbye ba nyid med do //
translated: In them there is no differentiation.

original: de bas na de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du rab tu rtogs pa na char bcad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du rab tu rtogs pa na char bcad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, when all of them are fully understood as emptiness, there is no cutting off.🔽Subhuti: How does one understand the Dharma-marks of dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par char bcad pa de rab tu rtogs pa med na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par char bcad pa de rab tu rtogs pa med na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there is no understanding of the ultimate cutting off.🔽Subhuti: How does one cultivate the path of a magical creation?

original: bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i lam sgom pa ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni sprul pa dper bstan pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i lam sgom pa ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni sprul pa dper bstan pa zhus pa'o //
translated: The question about the magical creation as an example.

original: rab 'byor lam bsgoms pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sprul pa'i dpe nyid sgrub po //
analyzed: rab 'byor lam bsgoms pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sprul pa'i dpe nyid sgrub po //
translated: The example of the emanation is established by Subhuti, on the basis of which path of meditation and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa la ji ltar rab tu rtogs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa la ji ltar rab tu rtogs te /
translated: The question Blessed One, how will the bodhisattva mahasattva fully understand all phenomena as non-existent? means how can one fully understand non-existence?

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rab tu rtogs par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rab tu rtogs par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the full understanding of things like the horn of a rabbit is not established.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten te /
translated: The question Is there any existent thing whatsoever that the Tathagata's emanation relies on,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: whether for the arising of defilement or

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pas 'gro ba dang thar pa mtshungs pa'i phyir rab tu rtogs pa yang med de
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pas 'gro ba dang thar pa mtshungs pa'i phyir rab tu rtogs pa yang med de
translated: for the arising of purification? means that since the Tathagata has no defilement and no purification, there is no full understanding because going and liberation are the same.

original: / med pa nyid du zhag pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ci yang ma yin no zhes @273a * //
analyzed: / med pa nyid du zhag pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ci yang ma yin no zhes @273a * //
translated: It is not anything at all, because it is just a non-existence.🔽  The Lord has taught that.

original: bstan to // bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar bar bgyi ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba yang ma mchis lags na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu'i mthar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba rang bzhin gyis yang dag par yod pa ma yin
analyzed: bstan to // bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar bar bgyi ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba yang ma mchis lags na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu'i mthar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba rang bzhin gyis yang dag par yod pa ma yin
translated: If, Lord, there is no transmigration through the five destinies of beings in cyclic existence, how can a Bodhisattva become a person?

original: pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The five destinies of beings in cyclic existence do not exist by intrinsic nature, and so are liberated by their intrinsic nature.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord said to Subhuti:🔽  What do you think, Subhuti?

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nam 'khor ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bka' stsal te byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nam 'khor ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: The Bodhisattva does not see beings or cyclic existence.

original: rma lam la sogs pa'i dpe de dag gis sngon mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: rma lam la sogs pa'i dpe de dag gis sngon mthong mod kyi /
translated: Although he has seen them before, like a dream, etc.,

original: 'on kyang de dag med par sems can rnams kyis mi shes te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag med par sems can rnams kyis mi shes te /
translated: beings do not know that they do not exist.

original: de bas na de dag shes par byed pa ni de'i skyes bu'i mthu yin no zhes bstan te /🔽de nyid rab 'byor gal te /🔽sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas /
analyzed: de bas na de dag shes par byed pa ni de'i skyes bu'i mthu yin no zhes bstan te / de nyid rab 'byor gal te / sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas /
translated: Therefore, it is the power of the person who knows them.🔽This is taught by the passage beginning with “Subhūti, if sentient beings

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du shes su zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du shes su zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: knew that all phenomena are like a dream, up to like an illusion, etc.”🔽The nature of all phenomena is a name because it is inclined toward it.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni ming ste gzhol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la ming zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni ming ste gzhol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la ming zhes bya ste /
translated: The nature of all imagined phenomena is called a name because

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi blo de la /🔽de bzhin du gzhol ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi blo de la / de bzhin du gzhol ba'am /
translated: the minds of sentient beings are inclined toward it.🔽In the same way, the nature of all phenomena is inclined toward the mind,

original: blo la rang bzhin de gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: blo la rang bzhin de gzhol ba'o //
translated: or the mind is inclined toward that nature.

original: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
translated: The absence of signs is one thing,

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: and the phenomena of the śrāvakas are another, etc.

original: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa yin la //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa yin la //
translated: The Blessed One said, “If all phenomena were signless,

original: nyan thos kyis chos la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas par rnam par bkod par gyur na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis chos la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas par rnam par bkod par gyur na /
translated: If the śrāvakas were to arrange the dharmas, etc., with characteristics,

original: de lta na ni skyon du yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni skyon du yang 'gyur na /
translated: then there would be a fault.

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: But since all of those are without characteristics,

original: de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes ston to //🔽des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa rnams la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes ston to // des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa rnams la /
translated: therefore there is no fault.🔽“Would that not disturb the dharma-dhātu?” means that if one conceptualizes characteristics in the absence of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid du rtogs na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du rtogs na /
translated: then,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can la so sor tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rab 'byor gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can la so sor tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rab 'byor gal te /
translated: because of apprehending the nature of suchness as distinct, that is the meaning of “disturbance.”

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs @273b pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs @273b pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: “Subhūti, if there were any dharmas not included in the dharma-dhātu, then there would be disturbance.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavān said,🔽“Subhūti, there are no dharmas not included in the dharma-dhātu.”

original: de ltar rtog tu zin kyang phyis shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rab tu rtog ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtog tu zin kyang phyis shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rab tu rtog ste /
translated: Thus, even though one has understood in that way, later on, with wisdom, one thoroughly understands that all phenomena are not different in the essence of the dharmadhātu.

original: de bas na rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, one does not become confused.🔽Subhūti, the form realm is the dharmadhātu.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi khams ni chos kyi dbyings so zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi khams ni chos kyi dbyings so zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of form.🔽Should one train in form?

original: ci gzugs la bslab par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings tsam du zad nas /
analyzed: ci gzugs la bslab par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings tsam du zad nas /
translated: Since all phenomena are exhausted as merely the dharmadhātu,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams shin tu med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams shin tu med pas /
translated: the phenomena of form and so forth are utterly nonexistent.

original: de la slob na phyin ci log dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob na phyin ci log dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: If one trains in that, it would be similar to error.

original: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
translated: One should thoroughly understand all phenomena as the dharmadhātu just as it is.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings rtsam du yang dag par rjes su mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings rtsam du yang dag par rjes su mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: And he sees that even forms and so on are the ultimate realm, and not otherwise.

original: sems can rnams la rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin du gzhug mi nus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan ma med par btags te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin du gzhug mi nus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan ma med par btags te /
translated: He labels forms and so on as signless, because he cannot lead sentient beings to grasp them in any other way.

original: thabs mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings nyid bstan to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings nyid bstan to //
translated: And by skillful means he teaches the ultimate realm itself.

original: rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Subhuti, if the ultimate realm were not as it was before, so it is later,

original: bar du yang de bzhin ma yin du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ces bstan te /
analyzed: bar du yang de bzhin ma yin du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ces bstan te /
translated: and in the middle it is not so, then, as it is said,

original: 'di la chos kyi dbyings sngon gyi byis pa so so'i skye bo'i dus na ni ma dag pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la chos kyi dbyings sngon gyi byis pa so so'i skye bo'i dus na ni ma dag pa yin /
translated: here the ultimate realm is impure in the past, in the period of ordinary people.

original: bar du byang chub sems dpa'i dus na ni dag pa dang ma dag pa yin /
analyzed: bar du byang chub sems dpa'i dus na ni dag pa dang ma dag pa yin /
translated: In the middle, in the period of the Bodhisattva, it is both pure and impure.

original: phyis tha mar ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis tha mar ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: In the end, in the period of the Buddha, it is very pure.

original: de la de tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de la de tsam du zad kyi /
translated: And that is all there is to it.

original: des de la bye brag yod par shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des de la bye brag yod par shes par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not understand that it has a difference from that.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dus thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par dag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dus thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par dag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is pure in its very essence, completely pure in all times.

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas nas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas nas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du /
translated: Subhūti, having made the limit of reality a measure,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod kyi /
translated: it is not the case that the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom for the sake of sentient beings.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du spyod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du spyod do //
translated: He practices for the sake of the limit of reality.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pas med pa'i sems can yongs su @274a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pas med pa'i sems can yongs su @274a * //
translated: Thus, having abandoned sentient beings who do not exist because they are nonexistent,

original: btang nas / yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid la rab tu dgod de /
analyzed: btang nas / yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid la rab tu dgod de /
translated: he establishes them in the essence of the limit of reality.

original: sems can gyi mtha' nyid yang dag pa'i mthar byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' nyid yang dag pa'i mthar byed do zhes ston to //
translated: He makes the limit of sentient beings itself the limit of reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid sems can gyi mtha' lags na zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid sems can gyi mtha' lags na zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du /
translated: Blessed One, if the limit of reality itself is the limit of sentient beings,

original: gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' ma gtogs par sems can gyi mtha' zhes bya ba med na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' ma gtogs par sems can gyi mtha' zhes bya ba med na /
translated: If there is no such thing as the end of sentient beings except for the end of reality,

original: 'o na sems can rnams dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na sems can rnams dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: then since sentient beings and the end of reality are one,

original: gang 'di skad du sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la dgod do zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la dgod do zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: it would be illogical to say, “I will establish sentient beings in the end of reality.”

original: de nyid de la 'god na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu 'jog go zhes bya bar 'gyur te /🔽de yang mi rigs so zhes zhus pa dang / thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god de /
analyzed: de nyid de la 'god na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu 'jog go zhes bya bar 'gyur te / de yang mi rigs so zhes zhus pa dang / thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god de /
translated: If you were to establish them in that, it would be as if you were establishing the end of reality in the end of reality.🔽But that is illogical.🔽The Blessed One replied, “With skillful means, I establish the end of sentient beings in the end of reality,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: without disturbing the end of reality.”🔽The end of reality is not established in the end of reality.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid la rab tu mi 'jog gi kun brtags pa'i sems can gyi mtha' dang / kun brtags pa'i sems can gyi dngos po bstsal nas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid la rab tu mi 'jog gi kun brtags pa'i sems can gyi mtha' dang / kun brtags pa'i sems can gyi dngos po bstsal nas /
translated: Having eliminated the imagined end of sentient beings and the imagined entity of sentient beings,

original: shin tu yongs su dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la thabs mkhas pas 'god pa la /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la thabs mkhas pas 'god pa la /
translated: Skillfully, they lead them to the utterly pure essence of suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la rab tu 'god pa zhes bya ste /🔽de bas na sems can gyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni tha mi dad cing gcig ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la rab tu 'god pa zhes bya ste / de bas na sems can gyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni tha mi dad cing gcig ste /
translated: The skill in means of establishing in the reality of the extremely pure thusness is called establishing in the limit of reality.

original: gnyis su med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the limit of sentient beings and the limit of reality are not different, they are one, and this is what is meant by non-dual.

original: de'i 'og tu de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha' yin par yongs su bsngos nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha' yin par yongs su bsngos nas /
translated: After that, when it was asked, What is such skill in means? [the Buddha] said, Having dedicated all phenomena to the limit of reality,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs mkhas pa yin par /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs mkhas pa yin par /
translated: the completion of the six perfections is skill in means.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to ;
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to ;
translated: Subhūti, here, from the initial generation of the mind of enlightenment, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice the perfection of giving.

original: / pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa de yang go sla'o //
analyzed: / pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa de yang go sla'o //
translated: The instruction on the perfections is easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are empty of inherent nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs chos dang lam yang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs chos dang lam yang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
translated: in emptiness of inherent nature, sentient beings are not observed, nor are phenomena or the path observed.

original: @274b chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin na sems can dang / chos dang / lam rnams med par ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba byas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: @274b chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin na sems can dang / chos dang / lam rnams med par ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba byas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bsgoms te /
translated: In this way, it is asked, “If all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, how do bodhisattvas, having brought sentient beings to maturity and brought the buddhadharmas to maturity, meditate on the knowledge of the aspects of the path

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par byed ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par byed ces zhus pa'o //
translated: and abide in omniscience?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One,

original: rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad du /
translated: with “Subhūti, if all phenomena were not empty of inherent nature,” and so on, said this:

original: gal te chos sam /
analyzed: gal te chos sam /
translated: “If phenomena

original: lam dag so so na yod na ni 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: lam dag so so na yod na ni 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: If the path and the purity existed separately, then it would be logical that some would be observed.

original: de lta na ni de bzhin du sems can dang / srog la sogs pa thams cad kyang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni de bzhin du sems can dang / srog la sogs pa thams cad kyang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, all things such as sentient beings and life would also exist.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la gnas pas sangs rgyas su yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la gnas pas sangs rgyas su yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva who abides in emptiness would not become a buddha.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bshad par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bshad par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And it would not be explained that all phenomena such as form are emptiness.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni chos sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni chos sam /
translated: However, in the emptiness of nature, there are no phenomena or

original: lam dag med de /
analyzed: lam dag med de /
translated: paths.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid de grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid de grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, that emptiness is established.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid de la gnas nas sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid de la gnas nas sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, abiding in that emptiness, one becomes a buddha.

original: stong pa nyid chos bshad par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid chos bshad par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And it is explained that emptiness is a phenomenon.

original: de bas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi dbang gis rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa grub po zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi dbang gis rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa grub po zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that, by the power of the emptiness of nature, the entry into omniscience is established.

original: de skad bka' stsal nas yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams nyi tshe stong par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal nas yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams nyi tshe stong par ma zad kyi /
translated: Having said that, he also teaches that not only are phenomena such as form and so on empty,

original: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin par /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin par /
translated: but also the sixteen kinds of emptiness, such as the emptiness of the inner, are the emptiness of nature.

original: rab 'byor gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: “Subhūti, if the emptiness of the inner were not the emptiness of nature…” and so on.

original: gal te nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: gal te nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang /
translated: If the emptiness of the inner and so on

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin du zin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin du zin na /
translated: were not the emptiness of nature,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bshad pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bshad pa mi 'grub po //
translated: then the explanation that all phenomena are emptiness would not be established.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin du zin na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba las kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin du zin na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba las kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: “The emptiness of nature would be destroyed” means that if the emptiness of the inner and so on were not the emptiness of nature, then the statement “all phenomena are the emptiness of nature” would be undermined.

original: zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i 'og tu stong @275a * //
analyzed: zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i 'og tu stong @275a * //
translated: The meaning of “it would be destroyed” is that it would be annihilated.

original: pa nyid chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ther zug tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa nyid chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ther zug tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: After that, the characteristic of the reality of emptiness is taught by “The emptiness of nature is not destroyed, does not endure,

original: phyis med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: phyis med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: and does not become nonexistent later.”

original: chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te ;
analyzed: chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te ;
translated: This characteristic of the reality of emptiness is also taught by four aspects:

original: rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa med pa dang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la sogs pa med pa dang / gnas dang yang dag par 'jug pa med pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa med pa dang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la sogs pa med pa dang / gnas dang yang dag par 'jug pa med pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: the absence of destruction and so on, the absence of increase and decrease and so on, the absence of a basis and correct engagement, and the absence of obscuration.

original: de la 'gres dang po ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'gres dang po ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first permutation is that it is not destroyed because it is unconditioned.

original: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It does not endure because it is the nature of nonentity.

original: 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It does not become nonexistent because it is liberated from going.

original: de nas yang gsum po de dag nyid zhib tu ston to //
analyzed: de nas yang gsum po de dag nyid zhib tu ston to //
translated: Then, those three are taught in detail.

original: yul na ni gnas zhes bya bas ni 'dus ma byas nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: yul na ni gnas zhes bya bas ni 'dus ma byas nyid du bstan to //
translated: “ Not located in a place” shows that they are unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas ni yul na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni yul na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conditioned things are located in a place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas pa ni dngos po med pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas pa ni dngos po med pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Not located in a direction” is pervaded by non-existence.

original: gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
translated: “ Not coming from anywhere”

original: gang du yang 'gro ba ma yin pa ni 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yang 'gro ba ma yin pa ni 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Not going anywhere” is liberated from going.

original: 'phel ba la sogs pa med pa'i 'gres ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba la sogs pa med pa'i 'gres ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The pattern of “not increasing” and so on is the same as before.

original: chos thams cad gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ All phenomena are non-abiding” because they are by nature non-abiding.

original: 'jug pa med pa ni nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ni nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Not entering” is because there is no definite emergence.

original: de dag gis ni chos 'di dag las gang la gnas te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni chos 'di dag las gang la gnas te /
translated: By those, “from what do they abide?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ces gang smras pa de la gnas te zhes bya ba dang / 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis gnyis nye bar brtags pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ces gang smras pa de la gnas te zhes bya ba dang / 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis gnyis nye bar brtags pa ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is the basis for what is said.  The words engaged and is engaged indicate the imputation of duality.

original: des chos gang la sgrib pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la chags pa'o //
analyzed: des chos gang la sgrib pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la chags pa'o //
translated: He does not see any dharma that is an obscuration means that he is not attached to emptiness.

original: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong par mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong par mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He sees all dharmas as unobstructed means that he sees all dharmas as empty.

original: de'i 'og tu gang la bdag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang la bdag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ston te /
translated: After that, he does not apprehend any dharma in which the self is not apprehended and so on teaches the essence of emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de la 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, this is the emptiness of intrinsic nature: 🔽The intrinsic nature of all dharmas is emptiness.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni @275b gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni @275b gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa yang bstan te /
translated: The so-called emptiness of intrinsic nature teaches the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bdag med pa de gnyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma'i dpes bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa de gnyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma'i dpes bsgrub pa'o //
translated: And those two selflessnesses are established by the Tathagata with the example of the monks and nuns that he emanated.

original: phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid phyin ci log ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas de nyid sngon kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs na ni phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid phyin ci log ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas de nyid sngon kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs na ni phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: That which is an error is not an error is the very same basis that is called an error in the prior imagined state.

original: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: In the state of complete purification, it is not an error.

original: rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rtog pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rtog pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the cause of imagination is the same as saying it is the effect of imagination.

original: de yang de la don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang de la don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: And that is not ultimate reality as it is is that the applications of mindfulness and so on are also imagined.

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is not ultimate.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And that emptiness of intrinsic nature is also called a perfection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang sngon gyi mthar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas dus gsum car du yang stong pa nyid yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang sngon gyi mthar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas dus gsum car du yang stong pa nyid yin no zhes ston to //
translated: And that emptiness of intrinsic nature is also emptiness in all three times, as indicated by the words “in the beginning too it was emptiness of intrinsic nature.”

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la yang spyod cing rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid pa de ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la spyod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la yang spyod cing rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid pa de ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la spyod na /
translated: Thus, it is amazing that they practice those phenomena that are emptiness of intrinsic nature and do not disturb that emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if one practices with respect to nonexistent phenomena, emptiness is disturbed.

original: de bas na gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba gsol te 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa na gzugs la sogs pa de dag gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba gsol te 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa na gzugs la sogs pa de dag gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa
translated: Therefore, form is not one thing and emptiness of intrinsic reality another.

original: nyid kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: nyid kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba med kyi /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva practices with regard to phenomena such as form, he does not think that form, etc. are one thing and emptiness of intrinsic reality another.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid stong pa nyid du mthong ba de ngo mtshar to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid stong pa nyid du mthong ba de ngo mtshar to zhes bya'o //
translated: It is amazing that he sees just those forms, etc. as emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Form itself becomes fully awakened to all aspects. This means that at the time of omniscience, phenomena such as form are fully realized.

original: de dag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different.

original: gzhan du na lha dang bcas /
analyzed: gzhan du na lha dang bcas /
translated: Otherwise, together with the gods,

original: bdud dang bcas /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas /
translated: together with Mara,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la /
translated: The world with its Brahma

original: gzhan du na zhes @276a * //🔽bya ba ni gcig kho nar te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes @276a * // bya ba ni gcig kho nar te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Otherwise means only one.🔽The world does not know the suchness of form, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams gcig kho nar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams gcig kho nar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
translated: as it is in reality.

original: mi shes pas /
analyzed: mi shes pas /
translated: Since it does not know,

original: de la mngon par zhen nas las bsags te /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen nas las bsags te /
translated: it accumulates karma, clinging to that,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin cing nye bar len to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin cing nye bar len to //
translated: and appropriates the maturation of form, etc.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyus kyang srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyus kyang srid par 'gyur te /
translated: And because of the appropriation, there is existence.

original: sdug bsngal las yongs su mi 'grol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las yongs su mi 'grol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that one does not go beyond suffering.🔽The emptiness of intrinsic nature does not disturb form, saying it is empty or not empty.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni stong pa'am mi stong pa zhes bya bar gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'du shes pas gzugs stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni stong pa'am mi stong pa zhes bya bar gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'du shes pas gzugs stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This means that the perception of duality does not disturb the emptiness of form,

original: gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no duality.

original: de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: In regard to those, this is form,

original: 'di ni stong pa'o zhes rnam par 'khrug par byed pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa'o zhes rnam par 'khrug par byed pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this is emptiness, there is no such nature.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnyis su dbye bas byang chub dang gzugs la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gnyis su byas nas gzugs la mi spyod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnyis su dbye bas byang chub dang gzugs la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gnyis su byas nas gzugs la mi spyod de /
translated: This is the naturelessness of the nature of things.🔽The bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not engage with enlightenment and form by way of a twofold division means that, having made a twofold division of enlightenment, he does not engage with form.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la spyod ces bya bar byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyang gnyis su byas nas gzugs la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la spyod ces bya bar byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyang gnyis su byas nas gzugs la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that, having made a twofold division of the bodhisattva and enlightenment, he does not engage with form, saying the bodhisattva engages in enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag byang chub dang gzugs la spyod do snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba ni bdag byang chub la spyod do snyam nas gnyis su byas te gzugs la mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag byang chub dang gzugs la spyod do snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba ni bdag byang chub la spyod do snyam nas gnyis su byas te gzugs la mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva does not think, “I am practicing for enlightenment and for form.”

original: 'dzin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni mtshan ma la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni mtshan ma la spyod pa'o //
translated: “He practices in the apprehension” means he practices in the sign.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas te zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas te zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: “He stands in the nature of form” means he stands in the emptiness of form.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa nye bar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang don dam par med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa nye bar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang don dam par med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “And that is only a conventional designation” means that even unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is ultimately nonexistent.

original: chos de dag nyid la spyod ces bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / sbyin bdag la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid la spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid la spyod ces bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / sbyin bdag la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid la spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “He practices in those dharmas” means that even though he does not apprehend the giving, the giver, etc., he practices in those dharmas, i.e., giving, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @276b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @276b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The Lord: How do Bodhisattvas, great beings, when they course in the perfection of wisdom, exert themselves in the path to enlightenment?

original: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni gal te byang chub kyi lam thams cad yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni gal te byang chub kyi lam thams cad yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means: If all the elements of the path to enlightenment do not exist.

original: gzugs mi sbyor mi 'byed de zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs mi sbyor mi 'byed de zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not unite or divide form, etc. because form, etc. do not exist.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is the perfection of wisdom fulfilled? Because it does not exist.

original: thabs mkhas pa bshad pa dang / gzung du med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa bshad pa dang / gzung du med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of skill in means and the explanation of the unapprehendable perfection are easy to understand.

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
translated: As to whether the thing exists as it is apprehended by the foolish common people or not,

original: yad par 'gyur ram zhes smos pa ni dus gsum car gyi smos pa'o //
analyzed: yad par 'gyur ram zhes smos pa ni dus gsum car gyi smos pa'o //
translated: The phrase would it be? refers to all three times.

original: gal te sngon dngos po yod par gyur la zhes bya ba ni sngon ni de dag thams cad yod par bzung la /
analyzed: gal te sngon dngos po yod par gyur la zhes bya ba ni sngon ni de dag thams cad yod par bzung la /
translated: If it were the case that a thing existed previously, then the error would be that all of them were apprehended as existent previously,

original: phyis med par bzung na ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyis med par bzung na ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and later they are apprehended as nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bas bsdus pa'i lam zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bas bsdus pa'i lam zhus pa'o //
translated: The phrase Bhagavan, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's path? refers to the request for the path that is included in the ripening of sentient beings and the purification of the buddhafield.

original: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug bshad pa dang / lam bshad pa dang / chos thams cad la bslab par bshad pa dang / mi gnas bshad pa rnams ni gzhung gi rjes su bsnyags te gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug bshad pa dang / lam bshad pa dang / chos thams cad la bslab par bshad pa dang / mi gnas bshad pa rnams ni gzhung gi rjes su bsnyags te gzung ngo //
translated: After that, the explanation of the six perfections, the explanation of the path, the explanation of the training in all phenomena, and the explanation of nonabiding should be understood according to the text.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: Bhagavan, if all phenomena are nonarisen,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam skyes par bgyid ces bya ba ni ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i tshig mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam skyes par bgyid ces bya ba ni ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i tshig mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the words those not generated should be generated are not correct.

original: chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are not generated.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na gang dag mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsod rnams dang bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na gang dag mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsod rnams dang bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs
translated: And how is that? Those who do not form volitions have all phenomena not generated. Those who abide in the non-conceptual samādhi do not form any volitions at all, whether virtuous, non-virtuous, or otherwise.

original: pa ci yang mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag nyid la ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ci yang mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag nyid la ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: For them, all phenomena are not generated.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo gang dag yongs su mi shes pas mngon par 'du byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad skyes pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo gang dag yongs su mi shes pas mngon par 'du byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad skyes pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Those foolish ordinary beings who, due to lack of understanding, do form volitions, for them all phenomena are indeed generated.

original: bcom ldan 'das @277a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @277a * //
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
translated: Well then, the elder Subhūti asked, Whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise, and so on.

original: chos nyid ni dus thams cad du rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /🔽de byis pa rnams la ni skye ba'i chos can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos nyid ni dus thams cad du rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin na / de byis pa rnams la ni skye ba'i chos can du 'gyur la /
translated: If reality is always and in every way the characteristic of non-error,🔽how could it be the dharma of the childish to arise,

original: mkhas pa rnams la ni mi 'gyur ba de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la ni mi 'gyur ba de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: and not the dharma of the wise?

original: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di bstan te /
analyzed: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di bstan te /
translated: When this was said, the Bhagavān said to Subhūti, It is so, Subhūti, it is so.

original: chos nyid la ni nam yang phyin ci log yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos nyid la ni nam yang phyin ci log yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Reality never has error.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su mi shes pa'i nyes pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes kun brtags pa rnams kyi kun brtags pa nyid skye ba las dgongs te bshad kyi /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su mi shes pa'i nyes pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes kun brtags pa rnams kyi kun brtags pa nyid skye ba las dgongs te bshad kyi /
translated: The imagined natures of the imagined are explained as having the imagined nature of arising, intending that the dharmas imagined as faults that are not at all known by childish ordinary beings arise.

original: chos nyid las dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid las dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the imagined nature of reality is intended.

original: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the elder Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags skyes par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang mi skye ba zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags skyes par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang mi skye ba zhus so //
translated: asked, “Bhagavān, is enlightenment attained by the path of arising?” and so on, asking about the arising and non-arising of the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: byang chub nyid kyang lam mo lam nyid kyang byang chub po zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang lam mo lam nyid kyang byang chub po zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: “Enlightenment itself is the path, and the path itself is enlightenment” means that the Bhagavān said this.

original: gnyi ga yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir byang chub dang / lam dag la tha dad pa gang yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir byang chub dang / lam dag la tha dad pa gang yang med mod kyi /
translated: Since both are distinguished by the purity of the dharma-dhātu, there is no difference at all between enlightenment and the path.

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir lam zhes bya /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir lam zhes bya /
translated: However, the former state is called the “path” because it is the cause.

original: phyi ma'i gnas skabs la ni byang chub ces bya'o //🔽don dam par ni de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe'am /
analyzed: phyi ma'i gnas skabs la ni byang chub ces bya'o // don dam par ni de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe'am /
translated: The latter state is called “enlightenment.”

original: lam ma yin pas thob par 'gyur zhes brjod du mi rung bar bstan to //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la /
analyzed: lam ma yin pas thob par 'gyur zhes brjod du mi rung bar bstan to // bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la /
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is not correct to say that enlightenment is attained by the path or that it is attained by what is not the path, because those two are not different.

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan gyis 'di skad zhus te /
translated: The Elder Subhūti asked this question: “Blessed One, if enlightenment is the path and the path is enlightenment, etc.”

original: gal te byang chub dang lam dag la tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub dang lam dag la tha dad pa med na /
translated: If there is no difference between enlightenment and the path,

original: de lta na ni lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the Bodhisattva who has attained the path would attain enlightenment itself.

original: de lta na ni gzugs kyi skur gtogs pa dang / chos kyi skur @277b gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad byang chub sems dpas kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs kyi skur gtogs pa dang / chos kyi skur @277b gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad byang chub sems dpas kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, the Bodhisattva would attain all the qualities of the Buddha, both those belonging to the form body and those belonging to the truth body.

original: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: When this was asked, the Lord,

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob ces bya ba'i tshig de ma bzhed nas /
