analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob ces bya ba'i tshig de ma bzhed nas /
translated: not accepting the words “attains the enlightenment of the Buddha,”

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: said, “What do you think, Subhuti?

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob bam zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob bam zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal te /
translated: Is the enlightenment of the Buddha attained?” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshig mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshig mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words are not tenable because there is no difference between the Buddha and enlightenment.

original: ji ltar tshig de mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar tshig de mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as those words are not tenable,

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The words the bodhisattva will attain enlightenment are not tenable.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub dag la tha dad pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub dag la tha dad pa med du zin kyang /
translated: After that, although the bodhisattva and enlightenment are not different,

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob par 'gyur bar kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par zhal gyis bzhes nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob par 'gyur bar kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par zhal gyis bzhes nas /
translated: the bodhisattva accepts the conventional expression that the bodhisattva will attain enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub 'thob pa'i rim pa bstan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub 'thob pa'i rim pa bstan te /
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having perfected the six perfections, and so forth, teaches the stages of attaining enlightenment.

original: de bas na de ltar kun brtags pa'i rim pa yongs su ma btang bas byang chub thob par 'gyur gyi 'phral la thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar kun brtags pa'i rim pa yongs su ma btang bas byang chub thob par 'gyur gyi 'phral la thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that by not abandoning the stages of conceptualization in that way, one will attain enlightenment, but not immediately.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba zhus pa dang / de'i dbye ba dag kyang go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba zhus pa dang / de'i dbye ba dag kyang go sla'o //
translated: Then, after that, he asks about the purification of the Buddha-field, and the divisions of that are easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nges zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nges zhes bgyi'am /
translated: Blessed One, is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva definite, or is he indefinite?

original: 'on te ma nges zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni ci nges pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi 'am /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni ci nges pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi 'am /
translated: This asks whether one who is definite is called a bodhisattva,

original: 'on te ma nges pa nyid la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa nyid la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: or whether one who is indefinite is also called a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi phung po'am /
translated: The aggregates of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /🔽zhes bya ba ni ci nyan thos sam /🔽rang sangs rgyas su nges pa la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am / zhes bya ba ni ci nyan thos sam / rang sangs rgyas su nges pa la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am /
translated: and the aggregates of the pratyekabuddhas🔽 This asks whether one who is definite as a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha is also called a bodhisattva,

original: zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: or whether one who is indefinite is also called a bodhisattva.

original: de lta bu lus ched du bsams shing /
analyzed: de lta bu lus ched du bsams shing /
translated: In that way, he intentionally takes on a body,🔽and through skillful means, he takes on existence.

original: thabs mkhas pas yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skye ba la dbang thob pas skye ba yongs su 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skye ba la dbang thob pas skye ba yongs su 'dzin gyi /
translated: This means that by attaining mastery over birth, he takes on birth.

original: las kyi dbang gis mi 'dod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis mi 'dod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: not by the power of karma, not unwillingly.

original: 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i las kyis ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad @278a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i las kyis ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad @278a * //
translated: Noble one, would you be reborn in the lower realms due to uncontaminated karma?

original: pa yan chad ni de'i las thams cad 'phags pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yan chad ni de'i las thams cad 'phags pa med pa yin no //
translated: On the eighth ground and above, all his karma is noble and uncontaminated.🔽 There is not the slightest contact with that.

original: de la reg par 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i reg pa'am /
analyzed: de la reg par 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i reg pa'am /
translated: That is, there is no contact with the contact of existence,

original: lta ba'i reg pa'am /
analyzed: lta ba'i reg pa'am /
translated: the contact of view,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i reg pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i reg pas so //
translated: or the contact of conceptualization.🔽 How are all phenomena included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa lags zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir khongs su gtogs pa'i tshig ma bzod nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa lags zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir khongs su gtogs pa'i tshig ma bzod nas zhus pa'o //
translated: Because they are empty by nature, he asks this question without being able to bear the inclusion.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis mi gtong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis mi gtong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Subhūti, are all phenomena not abandoned by all phenomena? and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni de'i tshe chos gzhan dag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni de'i tshe chos gzhan dag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Lord has said, “If the perfection of wisdom did not exist, then all the other perfections would exist.

original: de las gzhan pa med par 'gyur na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa med par 'gyur na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did not exist, then the perfection of wisdom would exist.

original: de lta na ni de mi rigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni de mi rigs par 'gyur na /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar na thams cad kyang stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar na thams cad kyang stong ste /
translated: Thus all are empty.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dus par rigs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dus par rigs so zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that they are included in the characteristic of emptiness.”🔽How do all dharmas stand in emptiness and accomplish the perfection of the superknowledges?

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin na rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa ji ltar sgrub par🔽'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin na rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa ji ltar sgrub par🔽'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: This is asking, “If it is emptiness, how does one accomplish the superknowledge of the maturation of karma?”

original: stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par sgrub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par sgrub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: In order to teach that one should accomplish them by way of emptiness, the Bhagavān said:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par shes par rnam par phye ste bstan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i chos bshad pa dang / gang zag tha dad pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par shes par rnam par phye ste bstan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i chos bshad pa dang / gang zag tha dad pa bstan pa dang /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas…” and so on, which is an explanation that distinguishes the superknowledges, an explanation of the dharmas that are the branches of enlightenment, an explanation of the different kinds of individuals,

original: sems can yongs su thar par bya ba zhus pa dang / lan btab pa dang / dge ba bsten pa dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su thar par bya ba zhus pa dang / lan btab pa dang / dge ba bsten pa dag ni go sla'o //
translated: questions and answers about the complete liberation of sentient beings, and the reliance on virtue, which are easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal 'tshal bas sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal 'tshal bas sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Bhagavān, will sentient beings attain complete nirvāṇa by understanding suffering?”

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one attains nirvana through suffering, origination, etc., then all ordinary people would attain nirvana,

original: de dag la @278b yang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la @278b yang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have suffering, origination, etc.

original: ji ste sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na ni de lta na nyan thos bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na ni de lta na nyan thos bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
translated: If one attains nirvana through the knowledge of suffering and the knowledge of origination, then one would attain the fruit of stream-entry, etc., like the sravakas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Then the Lord thought: “In both cases, one does not attain nirvana.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba bstan to //🔽gang dag bden par gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba bstan to // gang dag bden par gtogs pa'am /
translated: Thusness is taught as nirvana through the realization of sameness.🔽Those that belong to the truths

original: gang dag bden par ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag bden par ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: and those that do not belong to the truths.

original: nang gi phung po rnams ni bden par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi phung po rnams ni bden par gtogs pa'o //
translated: The inner aggregates belong to the truths.

original: phyi rol gyi rnams ni bden par ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnams ni bden par ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The outer ones do not belong to the truths.🔽Subhuti, there is no such dharma in which a bodhisattva mahasattva should look.

original: rab 'byor chos gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rjes su lta ba'i chos de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs nyid na chos thams cad med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rjes su lta ba'i chos de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs nyid na chos thams cad med pa'o //
translated: This is the non-existence of all dharmas in the state of complete accomplishment.🔽Having stood in that lineage, he does not fall into the head.

original: de rigs kyis la gnas nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de la chos la 'dun pa'i sred pa mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rigs kyis la gnas nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de la chos la 'dun pa'i sred pa mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means he does not create craving for the desire for dharmas.

original: de sdug bsngal rab tu shes pas kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas yongs su 'dris pa 'ba' zhig tu byed kyi /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal rab tu shes pas kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas yongs su 'dris pa 'ba' zhig tu byed kyi /
translated: Since he fully knows suffering, he does not generate a mind that focuses on suffering.

original: nyan thos kyi sar ltung du dogs pa'i phyir sems bcu drug po dag gis de mngon sum du byas nas mngon par ni mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar ltung du dogs pa'i phyir sems bcu drug po dag gis de mngon sum du byas nas mngon par ni mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that, by the knowledge of full attainment in the manner previously explained, he makes full attainment alone, but he does not manifest it by means of the sixteen mental states, because he fears falling to the śrāvaka level.

original: dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Enlightenment is a non-entity.

original: dngos po ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / brtags pa dang / ma brtags pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: dngos po ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / brtags pa dang / ma brtags pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: An entity is conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, imputed and non-imputed phenomena.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir brjod du med pa /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir brjod du med pa /
translated: Since it is free from their intrinsic reality, it is inexpressible.

original: don dam par gnas pa'i byang chub la dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par gnas pa'i byang chub la dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ultimate abiding enlightenment is called a non-entity.

original: de nas yang byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten gsum gyi chos rnams kun brtags pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de nas yang byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten gsum gyi chos rnams kun brtags pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Then, beginning with “The childish ordinary beings who are not learned,” it shows that all phenomena of the three worlds are just imputed.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa yin pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kho na zhes bya ba'i tha @279a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa yin pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kho na zhes bya ba'i tha @279a * //
translated: “ That which is non-existent is non-existence itself” means that because it is imputed, it is just the nature of non-existence.

original: tshig go // lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: tshig go // lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The path is non-existent.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The fruit of stream-entry is non-existent.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir thos pa zhes bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan to //🔽bcom ldan 'das dngos po byung ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir thos pa zhes bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan to // bcom ldan 'das dngos po byung ba'am /
translated: Thus, because it is the nature of non-existence, there is no such thing as “learning.”🔽Blessed One, is there no such thing as “the suchness of arisen things”

original: ma byung ba de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: ma byung ba de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: or “the unerring suchness”?

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'das pa'am phyis 'byung ba'am da ltar byung ba /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'das pa'am phyis 'byung ba'am da ltar byung ba /
translated: The meaning of not mistaken is the nature of reality, which is not past, future, or present.

original: 'dus byas pa don dam par gang yang mchis sam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa don dam par gang yang mchis sam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Are any compounded things ultimately existent?

original: rmi lam lta bu la sogs pa dpe drug po dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu la sogs pa dpe drug po dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The six examples such as the dream are easy to understand.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think?

original: chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu 'am rmi lam lta bu dag ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis de dag gi mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad kyang sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu 'am rmi lam lta bu dag ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis de dag gi mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad kyang sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Are those dharmas not like an illusion, not like a dream? and so on. With his Brahma voice, he teaches that all dharmas, up to their final limit, are like an illusion.

original: de bas na thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since everything is like an illusion, there is no fault.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus byas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus byas pa'o //
translated: Created means that they are created by the wholesome nature of the perfection of generosity and so forth.

original: sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bsams pa ste de bas na kun brtags pa'i zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bsams pa ste de bas na kun brtags pa'i zhes bstan to //
translated: Imagined means that they are preceded by thought. Therefore, they are taught as imagined.

original: rab 'byor 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad kyang lam bsgrub pa dang / lam skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad kyang lam bsgrub pa dang / lam skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Subhūti, moreover, all those dharmas are the establishment of the path and the generation of the path.🔽They are not the attainment of the result.

original: 'bras bu thob par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad gnas rnam par dag par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad gnas rnam par dag par byed pa yin pas /
translated: This means that all dharmas such as the perfection of generosity purify the basis.

original: gnas yongs su dag par byed na lam gyi rgyun 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas yongs su dag par byed na lam gyi rgyun 'gyur ro //
translated: When the basis is purified, the continuum of the path changes.

original: gang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i bdag nyid can dngos po med pa de dag phrad pa ni 'bras bu thob par byed pa med de /
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i bdag nyid can dngos po med pa de dag phrad pa ni 'bras bu thob par byed pa med de /
translated: That which is non-arisen and non-ceasing, which is not a real existent, does not cause the attainment of a result through contact.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid de bcos ma ma yin pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzung du med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i tshul du'am /
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid de bcos ma ma yin pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzung du med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i tshul du'am /
translated: This is the nature of things, which is not fabricated, and is the characteristic of reality.🔽The perfection of giving is ungraspable.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshul du gzung du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshul du gzung du mi rung ba'o //
translated: This is because it is not suitable to be grasped in the manner of a real existent or in the manner of a non-existent.

original: rab 'byor @279b gnyis kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med /🔽gnyis su med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med ces bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor @279b gnyis kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med / gnyis su med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med ces bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas sam /
translated: Subhūti, there is no realization through duality.🔽There is also no realization through non-duality.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong na ni gnyis kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong na ni gnyis kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to see any real existent, whether conditioned or unconditioned, then there would be realization through duality.

original: gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu dngos po med pa zhig yin na yang gnyis su med pas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu dngos po med pa zhig yin na yang gnyis su med pas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were utterly non-existent like the horns of a rabbit, it would be non-dual and so would be realized.

original: de bas na rnam pa de gnyis las bzlog pa ni mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa de gnyis las bzlog pa ni mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the realization of sameness is the opposite of those two.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that this is realization.

original: yongs su brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod par bya ba dang / rab tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la /
analyzed: yongs su brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod par bya ba dang / rab tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la /
translated: As for not expressed, it is not to be expressed or fully expressed.

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is to be done in terms of worldly convention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas ni shin tu mthar thug pa gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas ni shin tu mthar thug pa gnas gyur pa /
translated: By the Tathāgata fully awakened to the Dharma, it is the ultimate transformation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa thams cad spangs pa ni mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir shes par bya ba nyid kyang med de shes par bya bar 'gyur ba'i don mi gzigs pas ci zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa thams cad spangs pa ni mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir shes par bya ba nyid kyang med de shes par bya bar 'gyur ba'i don mi gzigs pas ci zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since the abandonment of all conceptualization and proliferation is the state of equality, there is no object of knowledge, because the object of knowledge is not seen. What is it that is fully awakened to?

original: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba gang zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yod na mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang yod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba gang zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yod na mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang yod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, what is the equality of phenomena that are essentially non-existent?

original: rab 'byor 'dir ni de nyid mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dir ni de nyid mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, here it is just that which is equality. The equality of phenomena that are essentially non-existent is the essential nature of the absence of an existent entity.

original: de'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conceptualization of it as an entity is also abandoned.

original: rab 'byor chos mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos mnyam pa nyid ni gang gi yul du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos mnyam pa nyid ni gang gi yul du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, the sameness of dharmas is not even the domain of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi gzigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi gzigs so //
translated: The Tathāgata does not see the essence of the sameness of dharmas.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'phags pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos mnyam pa nyid ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'phags pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos mnyam pa nyid ni mtshungs so //
translated: The sameness of dharmas of foolish ordinary beings, and so on, means that the sameness of dharmas of all āryas and tathāgatas is the same.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: They do not waver from the sameness of dharmas.

original: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa @280a * //
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa @280a * //
translated: And they also set forth the classification of dharmas.

original: yang mdzad ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pas mi g-yo la /
analyzed: yang mdzad ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pas mi g-yo la /
translated: They do not waver from ultimate truth,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par dgod pa mdzad do //🔽bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par dgod pa mdzad do // bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: and they set forth the classification of dharmas in the conventional.

original: chos nyid 'dus bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: chos nyid 'dus bgyid lags sam /
translated: Blessed One, is the dharmatā conditioned?

original: 'on te 'dus ma bgyid lags zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma bgyid lags zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: Or is it unconditioned? What is the meaning of this question?

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams kyi chos nyid de gal te 'dus ma byas yin na gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams kyi chos nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams kyi chos nyid de gal te 'dus ma byas yin na gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams kyi chos nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reality of these phenomena such as form, etc., were unconditioned, it would not be the reality of the conditioned phenomena such as form, etc.

original: gal te 'dus byas yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas yin na /
translated: If it were conditioned,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin de yang kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin de yang kun brtags pa ste /
translated: like form, etc., it would be imagined.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa can du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa can du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
translated: Thinking, it would be subject to arising and cessation, he asked this question.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin //
translated: Subhuti, it is neither conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyon gnyis su 'gyur du dogs pa'i phyir gnyis bsal ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyon gnyis su 'gyur du dogs pa'i phyir gnyis bsal ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the removal of the two doubts, because of the fear of the two faults.

original: 'dus byas las gud na yang 'dus ma byas dmigs su med la /
analyzed: 'dus byas las gud na yang 'dus ma byas dmigs su med la /
translated: The unconditioned is not perceived apart from the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas las gud na yang 'dus byas dmigs su med de zhes bya ba ni 'di la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ma dag pa gang yin pa de phung po la sogs pa de dag la logs shig na dmigs su med la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas las gud na yang 'dus byas dmigs su med de zhes bya ba ni 'di la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ma dag pa gang yin pa de phung po la sogs pa de dag la logs shig na dmigs su med la /
translated: The suchness of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on that is impure is not observed apart from those aggregates and so on.

original: phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par gud na dmigs su med de /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par gud na dmigs su med de /
translated: And those aggregates and so on are not observed apart from suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid ma dag pa ni de las de nyid dang / gzhan zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma dag pa ni de las de nyid dang / gzhan zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: That impure suchness cannot be said to be either the same as or different from it.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang gnyi ga las gud na dmigs su med pa de'i phyir de gnyi ga yang gcig go zhes brjod du mi rung bas ldan pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang gnyi ga las gud na dmigs su med pa de'i phyir de gnyi ga yang gcig go zhes brjod du mi rung bas ldan pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: Since neither is observed apart from the other, it is not tenable to say that they are the same. Therefore they are not conjoined.

original: / tha dad do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: / tha dad do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable to say that they are different, they are not disjoined.

original: gzugs can ma yin zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
translated: It is formless because it is not physical and is nonconceptual.

original: tshig la sogs pas bstan tu mi rung ba'i phyir bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pas bstan tu mi rung ba'i phyir bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is imperceptible because it cannot be indicated by words, etc.

original: dbang po'i yul gyi thogs pa med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gyi thogs pa med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unimpeded because it is not impeded by any sense object and because it is free of subject-object duality.

original: gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Both of these are characterized by the single characteristic of being without characteristics.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: Thus, they are characterized by the single characteristic of being without characteristics.

original: de la 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the conditioned is without characteristics because it does not exist.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mtshan ma med pas @280b mtshan mar gzung du mi rung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mtshan ma med pas @280b mtshan mar gzung du mi rung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is without characteristics because it is signless and cannot be apprehended as a sign.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas yod pa ma yin du zin kyang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu tha snyad 'dogs shing 'dus ma byas brjod du med pa yin yang tha snyad du brjod
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas yod pa ma yin du zin kyang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu tha snyad 'dogs shing 'dus ma byas brjod du med pa yin yang tha snyad du brjod
translated: Even though conditioned things do not exist, he designates them conventionally in worldly convention, and even though unconditioned things are inexpressible, he expresses them conventionally.

original: pa'o // de skad bka' stsal nas tha snyad de yod pa ma yin par /
analyzed: pa'o // de skad bka' stsal nas tha snyad de yod pa ma yin par /
translated: Having said that, he shows that those conventions do not exist:

original: don dam par ni lus kyi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: don dam par ni lus kyi 'du byed dam /
translated: ultimately, there are no bodily volitions,

original: ngag gi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed dam /
translated: no verbal volitions,

original: yid kyi 'du byed gang yang med do zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed gang yang med do zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: and no mental volitions.

original: las rnam pa gsum char yang kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum char yang kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all three kinds of actions are imaginary.

original: rab 'byor stong pa nyid ni ci yang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor stong pa nyid ni ci yang med /
translated: Subhūti, emptiness is nothing whatsoever,🔽it is not even the slightest thing.

original: cung zad kyang med ces bya ba ni ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med ces bya ba ni ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'o //
translated: Because it does not do anything at all, it is nothing whatsoever.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang med pa'o //
translated: Because it is the nature of non-entity, it is not even the slightest thing.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa ni rnam par rig par bya ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa ni rnam par rig par bya ba tsam du zad de /
translated: The Tathāgata’s deeds are merely to be known.

original: gal te sems can rnams bdag nyid kyis shes par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams bdag nyid kyis shes par gyur na /
translated: If sentient beings were to know by themselves,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes ston to //
translated: the Tathāgata would not be perceived.

original: bcom cung zad kyang yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom cung zad kyang yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Is there anything at all?”

original: gang gi tshe sprul pa med pas stong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa med pas stong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When there is no emanation, it is said to be empty.

original: de la 'du byed pa gang yin pa des stong ngo zhes bya ba ni de la gang 'dus byas so zhes 'du byed pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de med pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed pa gang yin pa des stong ngo zhes bya ba ni de la gang 'dus byas so zhes 'du byed pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de med pas stong pa'o //
translated: “It is empty of that which is fabricated by it” means that it is empty because there is no fabrication of that which is called “conditioned” that has the nature of grasping a sign.

original: rab 'byor la la zhig gi sprul pa sprul na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor la la zhig gi sprul pa sprul na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Subhūti, if someone were to emanate an emanation” means

original: sprul pa 'di sprul pa gzhan pa gzhan dag sprul pa byed do zhes bya ba de stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sprul pa 'di sprul pa gzhan pa gzhan dag sprul pa byed do zhes bya ba de stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Is there any non-empty thing whatsoever that this emanation emanates, another emanation?

original: gang gi tshe sprul pa zhig sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa zhig sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When an emanation emanates another emanation,

original: sprul pa de la stong pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ci yang yod dam zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa de la stong pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ci yang yod dam zhes smras pa'o //
translated: is there any non-empty nature whatsoever in that emanation?

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems rnam par sbas sam zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems rnam par sbas sam zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sprul pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, what do you think, is it hidden that this is an emanation,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ci stong pa nyid kyis rab tu bsgribs sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ci stong pa nyid kyis rab tu bsgribs sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that this is emptiness? Is emptiness hidden?

original: la la ni nyan thos kyis sprul pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: la la ni nyan thos kyis sprul pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: Some say that this is an emanation of a Sravaka, and so on.

original: tshig rnam pa bzhis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams bstan to //
analyzed: tshig rnam pa bzhis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams bstan to //
translated: By these four phrases, the mundane and supramundane dharmas such as the foundations of mindfulness are taught.

original: @281a * // nyon mongs pas sprul pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dang srog la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @281a * // nyon mongs pas sprul pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dang srog la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “Emanation through affliction” refers to the teaching of sentient beings, life, and so on.

original: las kyis sprul pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las kyis sprul pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “Emanation through karma” refers to the teaching of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: bskyed pa'am bkag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskyed pa'am bkag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Generation or cessation” means conditioned phenomena.

original: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslu bar bya ba'am der ba'am /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslu bar bya ba'am der ba'am /
translated: “Having the nature of non-deception, nirvana” means that in nirvana, there are no phenomena that deceive, nor are there any that are deceived,

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams med cing /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams med cing /
translated: nor are there any that degenerate.

original: bsnan par bya ba yang med pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba yang med pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is nothing to be added, it is said to “have the nature of non-deception.”

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yol gnyis kyis kyang mi gos zhes bka' stsal pa ltar na zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yol gnyis kyis kyang mi gos zhes bka' stsal pa ltar na zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: “And also, as the Blessed One said, ‘One does not avoid emptiness, nor is one defiled by duality.’

original: stong pa nyid las mi g-yo zhes gsungs pas stong pa nyid ni mi g-yo'i /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las mi g-yo zhes gsungs pas stong pa nyid ni mi g-yo'i /
translated: Since it is said that “it does not waver from emptiness,” emptiness does not waver.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni g-yo'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni g-yo'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that “the others do waver,” the others do waver.

original: gnyis kyis kyang mi gos so zhes gsungs pas ni yod pa dang / med pa gnyis kyis mi gos so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis kyang mi gos so zhes gsungs pas ni yod pa dang / med pa gnyis kyis mi gos so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that “it is not soiled by the two,” it is not soiled by existence and nonexistence.

original: de la gal te mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni stong pa nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni stong pa nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were any existent thing called “nirvana,” it would be other than emptiness.

original: yod pas gos par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pas gos par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it exists, it would be soiled.

original: de bas na tshig de brtsan par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa yang sprul pa yin no zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshig de brtsan par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa yang sprul pa yin no zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, taking this statement seriously, one should say that even nirvana is an emanation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan dngos po'i bdag nyid du ni gang yang med pas de yang stong pa nyid yin par rab 'byor de de bzhin no ;
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan dngos po'i bdag nyid du ni gang yang med pas de yang stong pa nyid yin par rab 'byor de de bzhin no ;
translated: Then the Lord said, “Subhuti, nirvana is also empty, since there is no existent thing called ‘nirvana’ that exists as a real entity.

original: / de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: / de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by That is so, Subhūti! and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa la ji ltar gdams par bgyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar zab pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su shes par nus pa'i gdams pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa la ji ltar gdams par bgyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar zab pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su shes par nus pa'i gdams pa zhus pa'o //
translated: How should a beginner be instructed? means that he asks for the instruction that is able to fully understand emptiness, the profound nature of reality, in the present.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad bka' stsal te /
translated: The Blessed One also said this:

original: gal te sngon dngos po yod par gyur la phyis rnal 'byor pa dag gis shes pa'i mthus ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis dngos po med par byas na ni de lta na /
analyzed: gal te sngon dngos po yod par gyur la phyis rnal 'byor pa dag gis shes pa'i mthus ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis dngos po med par byas na ni de lta na /
translated: If things existed before and were later made non-existent by the power of the yogis' understanding of emptiness,

original: las dang po pa dka' ba spyod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: las dang po pa dka' ba spyod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the beginner would have to engage in difficult practices.

original: 'di ltar dngos po yang dngos po'i bdag nyid du kun brtags pa'i yin pas med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yang dngos po'i bdag nyid du kun brtags pa'i yin pas med do //
translated: However, things do not exist because they are imputed as having the nature of things.

original: dngos @281b po med pa ri bong gi rva lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos @281b po med pa ri bong gi rva lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: Non-things are also not like the horns of a rabbit.

original: rang gi dngos po yang gang yang rung ba'i rang dbang can med do //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po yang gang yang rung ba'i rang dbang can med do //
translated: There is no independent nature of one's own at all.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i dbang gis yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i dbang gis yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if other things do not exist by the power of causes and conditions, etc.,

original: de la ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan gang yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan gang yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could there be any other thing called “intrinsic reality”?

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes shes pas nyes pa med do /🔽// / bam po nyi shu bdun pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes shes pas nyes pa med do / // / bam po nyi shu bdun pa ste tha ma /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that “intrinsic emptiness is also by intrinsic reality.”

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma 'bum pa'i bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma 'bum pa'i bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in 100,000 Lines,

original: da ni nyi khri lnga stong pa las gang 'byung ba de bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni nyi khri lnga stong pa las gang 'byung ba de bshad par bya'o //
translated: now I will explain what appears in the Perfection of Wisdom in 25,000 Lines.

original: de nas 'phags pa byams pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi don dang / de'i tshe 'dus pa'i 'khor gyi 'dul ba rnams kyi don du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa byams pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi don dang / de'i tshe 'dus pa'i 'khor gyi 'dul ba rnams kyi don du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Then, for the sake of future generations and for the sake of the disciples gathered at that time, the noble Maitreya asked the Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob bar 'tshal bas gzugs la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob bar 'tshal bas gzugs la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: The question How should one train in the bodhisattva trainings? and so on is asked by those who wish to train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: chos thams cad la tshul bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la tshul bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ste /
translated: The proper understanding of all phenomena is the bodhisattva training.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa nas /
translated: Therefore, the question How should one train in the bodhisattva trainings? and so on is asked by those who wish to train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: The question How should one train in form and so on, up to the buddhadharmas? is asked.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid la slob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gzugs ming tsam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid la slob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gzugs ming tsam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, in order to teach that training in emptiness is the bodhisattva training,🔽it is said that one should train in the thought that form is merely a name, up to🔽the thought that the buddhadharmas are merely names.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam mo zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis chos thams cad ming tsam du zad par gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam mo zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis chos thams cad ming tsam du zad par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is taught that all phenomena are merely names.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe /
translated: Blessed One, when🔽this is so, then the name form, for example, is apprehended as having a real basis.

original: 'di lta ste gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being shown:

original: gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming brjod pa ni ming tsam 'ba' zhig ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming brjod pa ni ming tsam 'ba' zhig ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The expression of the name form, for example, is not merely the indication of a mere name.

original: ming smos pa sngon du btang bas dngos po'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig blo la gzhag nas dngos po ston na /
analyzed: ming smos pa sngon du btang bas dngos po'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig blo la gzhag nas dngos po ston na /
translated: When the aspect of a real entity is posited in the mind by the prior mention of the name and the real entity is indicated,

original: de la ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ming tsam yin zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ming tsam yin zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: then how can form, etc. be mere names?

original: ming de dngos po med pa zhig yin na ni @282a * //
analyzed: ming de dngos po med pa zhig yin na ni @282a * //
translated: If that name were a non-entity,

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs par 'gyur ram /
translated: then it would not be tenable to say that it is mere name.

original: gzugs la sogs par dngos po med par mi 'ba' zhig yod du zin na ci la gnas shing gnas gang gis ming de 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par dngos po med par mi 'ba' zhig yod du zin na ci la gnas shing gnas gang gis ming de 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If form, etc. were non-existent as real entities, and only the name existed, then in what would it occur and by what basis would that name be applied?

original: ming de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That name would also be non-existent.

original: de bas na ming tsam zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na ming tsam zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is also unreasonable to say that it is merely a name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is what it means.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la glo bur du ming btags pa'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa ste gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la glo bur du ming btags pa'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa ste gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said this: “The term ‘form’ is a name that is suddenly given to this and that entity that is a causal sign of a compounded phenomenon.” Form and so on do not have the nature of a name.

original: gal te ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na brjod pa tsam gyis 'brel pas mi shes pa rnams kyang dngos po de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs rtogs par gyur pa'i rigs na de dag rtogs pa yang ma yin te /🔽de bas ni ming yang gzhan la /
analyzed: gal te ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na brjod pa tsam gyis 'brel pas mi shes pa rnams kyang dngos po de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs rtogs par gyur pa'i rigs na de dag rtogs pa yang ma yin te / de bas ni ming yang gzhan la /
translated: If they did have the nature of a name, then because of the connection with mere verbal expression, it would be reasonable that even those who do not know would understand the various aspects of the essential nature and the distinguishing attributes of those entities. But that is not understood.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yang gzhan te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yang gzhan te /
translated: Therefore, the name is one thing and the entities such as form are another.

original: tha snyad du rung bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po de dang de dag la phyis ming de 'byung ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tha snyad du rung bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po de dang de dag la phyis ming de 'byung ba tsam du zad do //
translated: In order to make it suitable for conventional usage, the name is later applied to those things.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of form, etc. is not a name.

original: glo bur zhes bya ba ni phyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: glo bur zhes bya ba ni phyis byung ba ste /
translated: “ adventitious” means “arisen later”;

original: bcos ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcos ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it means “artificial.”

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir 'du byed do //
translated: “ the appearance of a thing characterized by the formative forces” means that it is a formative force because it arises from causes and conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir mtshan ma'o //
translated: It is a sign because it appears to consciousness.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po ste /🔽'du byed kyi chos su snang ba'i gzhi la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po ste / 'du byed kyi chos su snang ba'i gzhi la /
translated: It is a thing because it has the nature of an entity.🔽The basis for the appearance of the dharmas of the formative forces is called a thing.

original: dngos po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the expression.

original: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa byams pas ming glo bur nyid yin pa ma bzod nas /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa byams pas ming glo bur nyid yin pa ma bzod nas /
translated: When this had been said, the noble Maitreya, unable to tolerate the fact that a name is adventitious,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming ma mchis par ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des ming de rig pa dang rtogs pa dang / 'tshal bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming ma mchis par ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des ming de rig pa dang rtogs pa dang / 'tshal bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is like this: without the name ‘form,’ that entity characterized by formative factors would not be known, understood, or cognized by that name.”

original: ming med pa'i dngos po tsam 'ba' zhig ma mthong bas 'di ni gzugs yin no zhes mi rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming med pa'i dngos po tsam 'ba' zhig ma mthong bas 'di ni gzugs yin no zhes mi rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that one does not know that this is form by merely seeing the entity that is without a name.

original: dngos po ma mthong bar yang ming brjod pa tsam gyis ni dngos po rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma mthong bar yang ming brjod pa tsam gyis ni dngos po rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, without seeing the entity, one does not know the entity by merely uttering the name.

original: de la gal te gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming phyis byung ste /
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming phyis byung ste /
translated: In this regard, if the name “form” occurs later,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin du zin @282b na ming ma brjod par yang /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin du zin @282b na ming ma brjod par yang /
translated: it would not be the intrinsic reality of that. Without uttering the name,

original: ming dang 'brel pa mi shes pa rnams kyis gzugs so zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ming brjod du zin kyang ming ni glo bur yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la blo skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: ming dang 'brel pa mi shes pa rnams kyis gzugs so zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ming brjod du zin kyang ming ni glo bur yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la blo skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: Even if the name is uttered, since the name is adventitious, it is not reasonable that the mind would arise with regard to the nature of the thing.

original: 'di ltar de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga ltar 'gyur te /
translated: However, both of these are the case.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning that form and so on are not the nature of the name.

original: ming de med par ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des zhes bya ba la /🔽med par ni zhes bya ba ni ming bor na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des dngos po de la /
analyzed: ming de med par ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des zhes bya ba la / med par ni zhes bya ba ni ming bor na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po des dngos po de la /
translated: Without that name, that entity which is the sign of the formative forces.

original: gzugs so zhes bya bar rigs pa med do zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs so zhes bya bar rigs pa med do zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Without means if the name is omitted, it is unreasonable to call that entity by the name form.

original: byams pa de'i phyir khyod nyid la dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: byams pa de'i phyir khyod nyid la dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Maitreya, therefore, I ask you about this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gsum gyi ming glo bur nyid yin pa dang / dngos po rnams ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gsum gyi ming glo bur nyid yin pa dang / dngos po rnams ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The Lord has taught that the three aspects are adventitious, and that things are not of the nature of names.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis ming glo bur yin par rig par byed ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis ming glo bur yin par rig par byed ste /
translated: One should understand that the three aspects are adventitious.

original: ming ma brjod par dngos po tsam gyis shes par mi 'gyur pa dang / dngos po gcig la ming du ma yod par snang ba dang / mang po la ming gcig yod par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming ma brjod par dngos po tsam gyis shes par mi 'gyur pa dang / dngos po gcig la ming du ma yod par snang ba dang / mang po la ming gcig yod par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, without the utterance of the name, the thing is not understood; because one thing appears to have many names; and because many appear to have one name.

original: de la rnam pa dang po ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang po ni /
translated: The first aspect is as follows.

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “ Maitreya, what do you think?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽khyod 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming de la ma brten /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / khyod 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming de la ma brten /
translated: It is thus:

original: ma gnas / gnas ma bcas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: ma gnas / gnas ma bcas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: Without relying on, without abiding in, and without being established in the name ‘form’ for this and that thing that is a causal sign of compositional activity,🔽would you know that thing that is a causal sign of compositional activity?”

original: gal te gzugs de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na gzugs kyi dngos po de la gnas pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gang yin pa de mi shes par yang brda mi shes pa rnams dngos po de tsam zhig mthong bas kyang /
analyzed: gal te gzugs de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na gzugs kyi dngos po de la gnas pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gang yin pa de mi shes par yang brda mi shes pa rnams dngos po de tsam zhig mthong bas kyang /
translated: If form were the entity of the name, then even without knowing the name “form” that exists for the entity of form,

original: 'di ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i ming du rtogs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i ming du rtogs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: why would those who do not know the name not understand the name “form” when they see just that entity?

original: gal te ming de dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin na dngos po ji lta bu yin pa mthong bas /
analyzed: gal te ming de dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin na dngos po ji lta bu yin pa mthong bas /
translated: If the name were the entity of that entity, then just as one sees what the entity is like,

original: dngos po'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de bzhin du ming shes pa'i rnam par shes pa yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de bzhin du ming shes pa'i rnam par shes pa yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: it would be logical that the consciousness that apprehends the characteristics of the entity’s features would also generate the consciousness that knows the name.

original: skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not generate it.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore form and so on are not the entity of the name.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is as follows:

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Maitreya, what do you think?

original: ming dang / brnga dang / tha snyad dang / btags pa @283a * //🔽rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: ming dang / brnga dang / tha snyad dang / btags pa @283a * // rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
translated: name, designation, convention, and imputation.

original: tha snyad dam /
analyzed: tha snyad dam /
translated: It is the imputation, designation, or adherence to the sign of a conditioned thing by means of various names, designations, conventions, and imputations.

original: 'dogs pa'am / mngon par zhen pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'am / mngon par zhen pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the imputation, designation, or adherence to the sign of an unconditioned thing by means of various names, designations, conventions, and imputations.

original: gal te dngos po ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
translated: If a thing were to have the nature of a name,

original: dngos po gcig la ming mang du yod de //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la ming mang du yod de //
translated: then one thing would have many names.

original: dper na tshor ba gcig la tshor ba dang / myong ba dang / rig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshor ba gcig la tshor ba dang / myong ba dang / rig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one feeling is called feeling, experience, perception, pleasure, pain, and equanimity.

original: de la gal te dngos po de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
translated: If a thing were to have the nature of a name,

original: tshor ba'i dngos po gcig la ming mang por brjod pa na ngo bo nyid du de las gzhan par 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dngos po gcig la ming mang por brjod pa na ngo bo nyid du de las gzhan par 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: then when one thing is expressed by many names, it would have a nature that is different from those. But that is not so.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that form and so on are not the nature of names.

original: rnam pa gsum pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa ni /
translated: The third is

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Maitreya, what do you think?

original: 'di la 'ga' zhig 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid la de las gzhan pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos por ming 'dogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' zhig 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid la de las gzhan pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos por ming 'dogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: Is it that someone else designates the name of the entity of the marks of formations to that very entity of the marks of formations?

original: gal te dngos po'i de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na gang gi tshe dngos po mang po la ming gcig tu brjod par gyur pa /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na gang gi tshe dngos po mang po la ming gcig tu brjod par gyur pa /
translated: If the nature of an entity were the nature of a name, when many entities are expressed by a single name,

original: dper na phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams zhes bya ba lta bu ste ;
analyzed: dper na phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams zhes bya ba lta bu ste ;
translated: for example, when it is said “the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,”

original: de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: at that time the natures of all phenomena would become one.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that form and so on are not the nature of names.

original: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: the noble Maitreya said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags na ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs pa kho nar mi 'gyur lags sam zhes gsol pas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags na ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs pa kho nar mi 'gyur lags sam zhes gsol pas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Bhagavān, if that is so, then would the intrinsic reality of form not be observed?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la ming du btags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la ming du btags te /
translated: The Bhagavān taught that a thing that is the sign of a compositional phenomenon is designated as a name.

original: gzhi dang bcas pa dang / gnas dang bcas par bstan gyi /
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas pa dang / gnas dang bcas par bstan gyi /
translated: He taught that it has a basis and has a location.

original: gzhi med pa dang gnas med pa ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: gzhi med pa dang gnas med pa ni ma bstan to //
translated: He did not teach that it is without a basis and without a location.

original: de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la gnas pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid ming yin par mngon no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la gnas pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid ming yin par mngon no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, because it is based on a thing that is the sign of a compositional phenomenon, it is evident that the intrinsic reality of a thing that is the sign of a compositional phenomenon is a name.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said,

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Maitreya, what do you think?

original: de gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is that the intrinsic reality of form?

original: btags pa tsam @283b du zad ces bya bas byams pa'i tshig de sel bar mdzad de 'di skad du dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming brjod pa dag la ci de'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes smra'am /
analyzed: btags pa tsam @283b du zad ces bya bas byams pa'i tshig de sel bar mdzad de 'di skad du dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming brjod pa dag la ci de'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes smra'am /
translated: The phrase merely a designation dispels Maitreya's words, and it teaches this: Do you say that the name 'form' expresses the intrinsic reality of that thing?

original: 'on te de'i ming brjod do zhes smra zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de'i ming brjod do zhes smra zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or do you say that it expresses its name?

original: 'di ltar ming brjod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming brjod do zhes zer te /
translated: It is said, It expresses its name.

original: de'i phyir de ni dngos po de'i ming brjod kyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin par mngon te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dngos po de'i ming brjod kyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin par mngon te /
translated: Therefore, it is evident that it expresses the name of that thing, not its intrinsic reality.

original: dper na 'jig rten na lhas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na lhas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the world, the name 'Devadatta' and so on.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that form and so on are not intrinsically names.

original: de skad bka' stsal pa dang 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal pa dang 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: When this was said, the noble Maitreya said:

original: bcom ldan ldan 'das gal te gzugs ming dang / 'du shes dang / brda dang / btags pa tsam lags shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan ldan 'das gal te gzugs ming dang / 'du shes dang / brda dang / btags pa tsam lags shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The Blessed One, if form is merely name, ideation, symbol, designation,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs par ston to //
translated: he shows that the entities of form, etc., are not perceived.

original: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni ming tsam tshor ba yang ming tsam zhes bka' stsal na de lta na /
analyzed: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni ming tsam tshor ba yang ming tsam zhes bka' stsal na de lta na /
translated: If the Blessed One said that form is merely name, and feeling is merely name,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: then the name “form” would be the entity of form,

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba'i ming yang tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba'i ming yang tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and the name “feeling” would be the entity of feeling.

original: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de yang bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de yang bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The Blessed One, in order to refute that, said:

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Maitreya, what do you think?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes dang / brda dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad tsam kho na gang yin pa de la skye ba'am 'gag pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes dang / brda dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad tsam kho na gang yin pa de la skye ba'am 'gag pa'am /
translated: In that which is merely the name, ideation, symbol, designation, and convention called ‘form,’ is there arising, ceasing,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: or affliction?

original: rnam par byang ba yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Are there any phenomena of purification?”

original: 'jig rten na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos can yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos can yin par rtogs so //
translated: In the world, these phenomena of form, etc. are understood to be subject to arising and cessation, subject to defilement and purification.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na ming dang skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ming gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na ming dang skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
