translated: If these phenomena of form, etc. were to have the nature of names, then the existence of names, birth, and cessation, defilement and purification would not be tenable.

original: de ltar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na ming ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ming ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that names are not the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad kyis gzugs ma mchis pa kho na lags sam @284a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad kyis gzugs ma mchis pa kho na lags sam @284a * //
translated: “Subhūti, is it not the case that in every way, form is absolutely non-existent in terms of all its characteristics?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gzugs ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gzugs ni ming tsam mo //
translated: What is the meaning of the statement by the Lord that form is a mere name,

original: tshor ba ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs pa de ci lags /🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi thams cad du ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: tshor ba ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs pa de ci lags / gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi thams cad du ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: and that feeling is a mere name?🔽Is it that the characteristics of form and so on are totally and completely non-existent?

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du ma mchis pa la dgongs te gsungs zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du ma mchis pa la dgongs te gsungs zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Or is it that form and so on themselves are totally and completely non-existent?🔽With this doubt, he asks.

original: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chad par 'dzin du dogs nas /
analyzed: de skad gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chad par 'dzin du dogs nas /
translated: When this was said, the Lord, fearing that he would grasp at annihilation,

original: byams pa rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad kyis gzugs med do zhes mi smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad kyis gzugs med do zhes mi smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa mdzad do //
translated: refuted him, saying, Maitreya, I do not say that form is totally and completely non-existent in all aspects and in all characteristics.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs mchis pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas de yod pa'i rnam pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs mchis pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas de yod pa'i rnam pa zhus so //
translated: asking about the mode of existence of form and so on, said, Blessed One, how does form exist?

original: byams pa 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad kyis gzugs yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: byams pa 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad kyis gzugs yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The Lord, saying, Maitreya, form exists by worldly convention and designation,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang gis ni yod kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang gis ni yod kyi /
translated: The Lord has distinguished and taught that they exist by the power of conventional truth,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang gis ni med do zhes rnam par phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang gis ni med do zhes rnam par phye ste bstan to //
translated: but do not exist by the power of ultimate truth.

original: de nas 'phags pa byams pas bcom ldan 'das ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa byams pas bcom ldan 'das ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: Then the noble Maitreya said to the Lord, “According to my understanding of the meaning of what the Lord has said,” and so on.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa don dam par rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes bshad na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa don dam par rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes bshad na /
translated: If it is explained that form and so on do not exist ultimately in any way,

original: de lta na chad par smra ba la sogs pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na chad par smra ba la sogs pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one would be a nihilist and so on.

original: de la don dam par med do zhes gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don dam par med do zhes gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of the Lord in saying that they do not exist ultimately is this:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par ming gdags su rung ba'i dngos po ni don dam par med kyi /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par ming gdags su rung ba'i dngos po ni don dam par med kyi /
translated: Things that are suitable to be designated by names such as “form” do not exist ultimately.

original: ming du byar mi rung ba brjod du med pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming du byar mi rung ba brjod du med pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: An entity that is not suitable to be named, that is inexpressible, is ultimately existent.

original: de skad ces gsol pa nas /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa nas /
translated: Having said that,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings don dam par mchis su lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings don dam par mchis su lags na /
translated: if the inexpressible realm exists ultimately,

original: 'o na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang la gzugs zhes bgyi bar glo bur du ming du 'dogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhus so //
analyzed: 'o na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang la gzugs zhes bgyi bar glo bur du ming du 'dogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhus so //
translated: then how could the name “form” be adventitiously designated to a thing that is a sign of a compounded phenomenon?

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / ming gi ngo @284b bos don dam pa'i dbyings brjod du med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / ming gi ngo @284b bos don dam pa'i dbyings brjod du med pa yin na /
translated: If the ultimate realm is inexpressible by the names and ideas of form and so on,

original: gang la 'du shes gdags pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang yin pa de la don dam par yod dam med ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ga la yod /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gdags pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang yin pa de la don dam par yod dam med ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ga la yod /
translated: then how could it be said that it is ultimately existent or nonexistent in a thing that is a sign of a compounded phenomenon to which ideas are designated?

original: de skad ces gsol nas yang bdag nyid kyis gal te don dam par ma mchis na ni 'o na brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings su yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol nas yang bdag nyid kyis gal te don dam par ma mchis na ni 'o na brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings su yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: Having said that, he himself asks, “If it does not exist ultimately, then how could it be in the inexpressible realm?”

original: des ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that explained?

original: brjod du med pa don dam pa'i dbyings kyi gnas su gyur pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod du med pa don dam pa'i dbyings kyi gnas su gyur pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other state of the inexpressible ultimate realm,

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po nyid de'i gnas yin par khas blang ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po nyid de'i gnas yin par khas blang ngo //
translated: one must accept that the entity of the sign of compositional activity is its state.

original: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de /
translated: If the entity of the sign of compositional activity

original: don dam par med na /🔽'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la brjod du med pa'i dbyings gnas so zhes byar ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par med na / 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po la brjod du med pa'i dbyings gnas so zhes byar ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: does not exist ultimately,🔽it is illogical to say that the inexpressible realm is present in the entity of the sign of compositional activity.

original: de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po ni brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings zhes bgyir mi rung ngo zhes gsol to //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po ni brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings zhes bgyir mi rung ngo zhes gsol to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the entity of the sign of compositional activity is not suitable to be called the inexpressible realm.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de med pa dang / ji ltar de med kyang gzhir 'gyur ba de bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de med pa dang / ji ltar de med kyang gzhir 'gyur ba de bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Then, the Lord, wishing to teach how that entity which is the sign of the compounded does not exist, and how, even though it does not exist, it becomes the basis,

original: byams pa de'i phyir don de khyod nyid la dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la dris so //
analyzed: byams pa de'i phyir don de khyod nyid la dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la dris so //
translated: asked Maitreya, “Therefore, Maitreya, I ask you about this matter.”

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems gang gi tshe khyod brjod du med pa'i dbyings shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems gang gi tshe khyod brjod du med pa'i dbyings shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Maitreya, what do you think? When you abide in the practice of the perfection of wisdom, the inexpressible realm, at that time…”

original: byams pa khyod gang gi tshe shes rab yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i dbyings 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: byams pa khyod gang gi tshe shes rab yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i dbyings 'dzin pa na /
translated: Maitreya, when you apprehend the completely pure wisdom, the inexpressible realm,

original: ci de'i tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de khyod la snang ngam /
analyzed: ci de'i tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de khyod la snang ngam /
translated: at that time, does that entity which is the sign of the compounded appear to you?

original: 'on te de mi snang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de mi snang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or does it not appear?”

original: byang chub sems dpas gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gsol pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ste mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ste mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Blessed One, it is not apprehended.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byams pa rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Maitreya, by this explanation, what is taught?

original: 'di ltar khyod don dam pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa'i tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po mi snang bas don dam par ni de med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod don dam pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa'i tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po mi snang bas don dam par ni de med kyi /
translated: Thus, when you cultivate attention to the ultimate, since the entity of the sign of compositional activity does not appear, you should understand that ultimately it does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu yong par shes par gyis shig / kun rdzob de yang don dam par de nyid dam gzhan du brjod par mi nus so //🔽de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang yin @285a * //🔽pa de brjod du med pa'i dbyings kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yong par shes par gyis shig / kun rdzob de yang don dam par de nyid dam gzhan du brjod par mi nus so // de bas na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang yin @285a * // pa de brjod du med pa'i dbyings kyang ma yin la /
translated: However, it does exist conventionally. Moreover, that conventional reality cannot be expressed as either the same as or different from the ultimate.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan pa yang ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan pa yang ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the entity of the sign of compositional activity is neither the inexpressible realm nor is the inexpressible realm other than the entity of the sign of compositional activity.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid kyi phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byams pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de gal te brjod du med pa'i dbyings yin du zin na 'o na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid kyi phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byams pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de gal te brjod du med pa'i dbyings yin du zin na 'o na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las
translated: After that, in order to teach the faults of that position, it says:🔽If that thing that is the sign of compositional activity were the inexpressible dhātu, then all ordinary beings would be🔽liberated.

original: 'das par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'das par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: After that, in order to teach the faults of that position, Maitreya said, “If that thing which is the sign of compositional activity is the inexpressible realm, then all ordinary beings would be completely liberated.”

original: gal te kun rdzob nyid don dam pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob nyid don dam pa yin na /
translated: If the conventional were the ultimate,

original: 'o na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid brjod du med pa'i dbyings su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid brjod du med pa'i dbyings su 'gyur ro //
translated: then that thing which is the sign of compositional activity would be the inexpressible realm.

original: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po mngon sum du byas pas brjod du med pa'i dbyings mngon sum du byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po mngon sum du byas pas brjod du med pa'i dbyings mngon sum du byas par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, by directly perceiving that thing which is the sign of compositional activity, one would directly perceive the inexpressible realm.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all ordinary beings would attain unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i 'go tu gzhan pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byams pa gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan yin du zin na ni /
analyzed: de'i 'go tu gzhan pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byams pa gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan yin du zin na ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the faults of the other position, Maitreya says, “If the inexpressible realm were different from the thing that is the sign of compositional activity…”

original: 'o na mtshan ma de yang mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na mtshan ma de yang mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If that sign is not observed…” and so on.

original: gal te kun rdzob las don dam pa gzhan zhig yin na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan te tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob las don dam pa gzhan zhig yin na ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po las brjod du med pa'i dbyings gzhan te tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the ultimate were different from the conventional, then the inexpressible realm would be different, or separate, from the thing that is the sign of compositional activity.

original: de ltar gyur na chos las chos nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na chos las chos nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, the ultimate nature would be different from the phenomenon.

original: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na brjod du med pa'i don dam pa'i dbyings rab tu rtog pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na brjod du med pa'i don dam pa'i dbyings rab tu rtog pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: What is the fault of that? The ultimate inexpressible realm would not be established as a conception.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don dam pa'i dbyings ni mtshan ma med pa yin na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbyings ni mtshan ma med pa yin na /
translated: If the ultimate realm is signless,

original: mtshan ma med pa de rnam pa gang gis rnam par shes pa la snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa de rnam pa gang gis rnam par shes pa la snang bar 'gyur /
translated: by what aspect would that signless appear to consciousness?

original: gang gi tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang chos kyi dbyings tha dad pa ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang chos kyi dbyings tha dad pa ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the sign of compositional activity and the ultimate expanse are not different,

original: 'du byed kyi dngos po de dang chos kyi dbyings de'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi dngos po de dang chos kyi dbyings de'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: then it is logical to say that the sign of compositional activity is the cause of the ultimate expanse.

original: sngar mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings dmigs pa'i dngos por byas nas /
analyzed: sngar mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings dmigs pa'i dngos por byas nas /
translated: Previously, the expanse with signs was taken as the object.

original: phyis shes rab kyis don dam pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: phyis shes rab kyis don dam pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Later, when wisdom discriminates the ultimate,🔽it is logical to say that it takes the ultimate as the nature of non-entityness.

original: de dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du don dam pa la dmigs so zhes brjod pa ni rigs so zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du don dam pa la dmigs so zhes brjod pa ni rigs so zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.🔽Thus, the Bhagavān taught that the entity of compositional activity does not exist ultimately, and that the ultimate is free from being the same as or different from that.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi dngos po don dam par med @285b pa dang / don dam pa yang de nyid gzhan las rnam par grol bar bstan pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'phags pa byams pas de 'khrul pa yod par dogs nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi dngos po don dam par med @285b pa dang / don dam pa yang de nyid gzhan las rnam par grol bar bstan pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'phags pa byams pas de 'khrul pa yod par dogs nas /
translated: Then, Ārya Maitreya, fearing that this would be mistaken, said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings dang 'brel ba'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings dang 'brel ba'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang zhus te /
translated: The Lord, the bodhisattva abiding in the practice of wisdom connected with the inexpressible realm, etc.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa sgom pa na 'du byed kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa sgom pa na 'du byed kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva cultivates the mental attention of the inexpressible realm, at that time he does not perceive the thing that is a compositional phenomenon.

original: dngos po de med pa'i phyir mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: dngos po de med pa'i phyir mi dmigs sam /
translated: Is it because that thing does not exist that he does not perceive it?

original: 'on te brjod du med pa'i dbyings dang / 'brel ba'i shes rab la spyod pas ;
analyzed: 'on te brjod du med pa'i dbyings dang / 'brel ba'i shes rab la spyod pas ;
translated: Or is it because he practices wisdom connected with the inexpressible realm,

original: dngos po la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: and therefore does not engage with things, that he does not perceive them?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said,

original: byams pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la ni rang dbang nyid dam yod pa nyid gang yang med do zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byams pa 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la ni rang dbang nyid dam yod pa nyid gang yang med do zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Maitreya, that thing which is the sign of a compositional phenomenon has no independence or existence whatsoever.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la don dam pa 'dzin pa'i mthu med de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la don dam pa 'dzin pa'i mthu med de /
translated: Although the things that are the signs of compositional activity do not exist, childish ordinary beings do not have the power to apprehend the ultimate.

original: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang / las rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang / las rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis /
translated: Due to the power of causes and conditions such as the error of ignorance and the ripening of karma,

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i dngos po dag rnam par shes pa la phyin ci log tu snang gi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i dngos po dag rnam par shes pa la phyin ci log tu snang gi /
translated: things that are under the power of something else appear in consciousness in an erroneous way.

original: rang dbang du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not independent.

original: de la gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yid la byed pa sgom pa la brtson pa de'i tshe ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pas /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yid la byed pa sgom pa la brtson pa de'i tshe ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pas /
translated: When bodhisattvas are diligent in cultivating mental attention, at that time, since the causes and conditions such as ignorance do not exist,

original: ji ltar sngon gzhan gyi dbang gis bdag nyid du snang ba de ltar mi snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon gzhan gyi dbang gis bdag nyid du snang ba de ltar mi snang ngo //
translated: things do not appear as they did before, under the power of something else, as if they were a self.

original: rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa med par yang 'du byed kyi dngos po de rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu yang med do //
analyzed: rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa med par yang 'du byed kyi dngos po de rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu yang med do //
translated: Also, without the causes such as ignorance, those things that are compositional activity do not have the power to arise independently.

original: de bas na dngos po de la rang dbang du yod pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po de la rang dbang du yod pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that nothing exists independently in that entity.

original: de bas na med pa ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na med pa ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that what does not exist does not appear.

original: byams pa gang gi tshe khyod 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba de nyid dang / phyin ci log tu mi 'byung ba ston te /
analyzed: byams pa gang gi tshe khyod 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba de nyid dang / phyin ci log tu mi 'byung ba ston te /
translated: Maitreya, when you conceptualize that entity which is the sign of compositional activity, at that time... and so on. This teaches that the dependent nature arises as the nature of non-error, and that it does not arise as error.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis phyin ci log tu dmigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis phyin ci log tu dmigs so //
translated: When there is conceptualization, at that time there is apprehension of error due to the power of conceptualization.

original: @286a * // gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa de'i tshe ni gzhan gyi dbang med pas phyin ci ma log pa /
analyzed: @286a * // gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa de'i tshe ni gzhan gyi dbang med pas phyin ci ma log pa /
translated: When there is no conceptualization, at that time there is non-error due to the absence of the dependent nature.

original: don dam pa nyid la dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid la dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that at that time there is apprehension of ultimate reality.

original: de skad dris pa dang 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de skad dris pa dang 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: When asked this, the noble Maitreya said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags so zhes khas blangs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags so zhes khas blangs so //
translated: The Lord agreed, saying, “So it is. ”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord,

original: byams pa de lta yin na de rnam par rtog pa tsam du ma zad dam zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa tsam du rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: byams pa de lta yin na de rnam par rtog pa tsam du ma zad dam zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa tsam du rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: having established that it is not just mere conceptualization, said, “Maitreya, if that is so, is it not just mere conceptualization? ”

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po yod pa bsal ba'i phyir de de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po yod pa bsal ba'i phyir de de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas te /
translated: Then, in order to eliminate the existence of things, he said, “Thus, abiding in the nonconceptual realm,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams dang bral bar gyur pa na de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams dang bral bar gyur pa na de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: when one becomes free from conceptualization, what exists there? ”

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “ There” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par med na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par med na zhes bya'o //
translated: “ Thus” means ultimately non-existent.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i dbyings la gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i dbyings la gnas pa na'o //
translated: “ In the nonconceptual realm” means in the ultimate realm.

original: de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la yod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ What exists there” means what exists in that thing characterized by formations.

original: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as saying “non-existence.”

original: gang yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur na dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur na dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, it would be apprehended. It is the same as saying “if it were to exist, it would be apprehended.”

original: de ltar 'du byed kyi dngos po yod pa ma yin par yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang 'phags pa byams pas kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu /🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed kyi dngos po yod pa ma yin par yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang 'phags pa byams pas kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi de'i 'og tu /
translated: Thus, after the non-existence of the entities of compositional activity has been thoroughly demonstrated, in order to demonstrate the classification of all phenomena, such as form, in terms of the conventional and the ultimate, the noble Maitreya then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi la zhugs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi la zhugs pas /
translated: “Blessed One, bodhisattvas who are engaged in wisdom🔽should understand the classifications of form in how many ways?”

original: gzugs rab tu dbye ba'i brtags pa rnam pa du zhig tu rtogs par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: gzugs rab tu dbye ba'i brtags pa rnam pa du zhig tu rtogs par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught the classification,🔽saying, “Maitreya, they should be understood in three ways.”

original: byams pa rnam pa gsum du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa gsum du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: and so on.

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The form of the imagined, the form of the discrimination, and the form of reality.

original: kun brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las @286b 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'dus par bstan to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las @286b 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'dus par bstan to //
translated: The imagined buddha qualities, the discriminated buddha qualities, and the reality buddha qualities.

original: de nas yang 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de nas yang 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: Then again, the noble Maitreya🔽asked, “What is the form of the imagined?” and so forth, and the Lord

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: replied,

original: byams pa gang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad la brten nas gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtogs pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa gang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad la brten nas gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtogs pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Maitreya, that which is the entity of the signs of compositional activity, in dependence on the name, conception, designation, and convention “form,” is thoroughly imagined to be the reality of form. This is called “imagined form.”

original: tha snyad la brten nas /
analyzed: tha snyad la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the convention,

original: tha snyad kyi rgyu 'du byed kyi dngos po la gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'i 'du shes dang brtags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rgyu 'du byed kyi dngos po la gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'i 'du shes dang brtags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the entity of compositional activity, which is the cause of the convention, is imagined to be the reality of form. The conception and designation of that imagined form is called “imagined form.”

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni gsum ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni gsum ste /
translated: The reality of phenomena is threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: the imagined reality, the reality of other-dependence, and the reality of full perfection.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams la gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams la gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The aspect of the verbal expression “form,” etc., of things such as form, etc., is the imagined reality.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa la chos rnams su phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa la chos rnams su phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The aspect of the appearance of things as erroneous in consciousness due to the influence of ignorance, etc., is the other-dependent reality.

original: gang ming de dang / phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rnam pa de dang bral ba brjod du med pa /
analyzed: gang ming de dang / phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rnam pa de dang bral ba brjod du med pa /
translated: The aspect that is free from that name and that erroneous appearance, which is inexpressible,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: signless, is the ultimate reality, the perfected reality.

original: 'di rgyas par ni rab tu byed pa las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyas par ni rab tu byed pa las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the treatise itself.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag dang / 'dir kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba de dag go rims bzhin du bstan par bya ste /🔽de la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / kun brtags pa'i tshor ba dang / kun brtags pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag dang / 'dir kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba de dag go rims bzhin du bstan par bya ste / de la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / kun brtags pa'i tshor ba dang / kun brtags pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod de /
translated: The three natures and the imagined form, the conceptually differentiated form, and the form of reality should be understood in the same order.🔽The imagined form is the imagined form, feeling, conception, etc., which are expressed by such terms as “form,” “feeling,” “conception,” etc.🔽The name “form,” etc., is applied to the things that are the signs of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la gzugs so zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes dang / btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //🔽de'i @287a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de la gzugs so zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes dang / btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //🔽de'i @287a * //
translated: The conceptually differentiated form is the form, etc., that is the object of the notional attachment to the duality of subject and object, which is due to the habitual adherence to the imagined form, etc.🔽The form of reality is the absence of the duality of subject and object in the imagined form, etc.

original: 'og tu rnam pa gnyis ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi chos nyid la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas mngon par brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: 'og tu rnam pa gnyis ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi chos nyid la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas mngon par brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The two below are taught by “that entity characterized by formative factors is verbal expression based on the conceptualization that abides in the reality of mere conceptualization.”

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams la dngos po'i rnam par blo skye zhing snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams la dngos po'i rnam par blo skye zhing snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising and appearance of the mind as an entity to childish ordinary beings whose minds are distorted by the causes and conditions of affliction, karma, and karmic maturation and so on is called imagined form.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston te /
translated: That entity characterized by formative factors and so on teaches that.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi chos nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par ngo bo nyid gzhan med de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi chos nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par ngo bo nyid gzhan med de /
translated: Abiding in the reality of mere conceptualization refers to the absence of any other entity apart from the aspect that is conceptually imagined by the mind.

original: de bas na dngos po de rnam par brtags pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po de rnam par brtags pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas te /
translated: Therefore, the entity is based on the mere aspect of the nature that is conceptually differentiated.

original: de la gnas pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is based on that is called conceptualization.

original: de ltar blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa rnam par rtog pa de nyid la brten te nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: de ltar blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa rnam par rtog pa de nyid la brten te nye bar bzung nas /
translated: In that way, based on that conceptualization which is based on the mere aspect of the nature that is conceptually differentiated by the mind,

original: gang mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa dngos po'i bdag nyid du kun tu g-yengs pa'i rnam pa la mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa dngos po'i bdag nyid du kun tu g-yengs pa'i rnam pa la mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that which is related to verbalization is called verbalization, which is a mode of distraction in the nature of an entity.

original: de ltar blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa la brten nas blo la dngos po'i bdag nyid du snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar blos rnam par brtags pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa la brten nas blo la dngos po'i bdag nyid du snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In that way, based on the mode called “based on the nature that is conceptually differentiated by the mind,” the appearance as the nature of an entity to the mind is called “the form that is conceptually differentiated.”

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to feelings and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu chos nyid kyi gzugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos nyid kyi gzugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: After that, the sutra says, “Whether the Tathagatas arise or not, the dharmata form abides.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung zhes bya ba 'dis chos nyid de ngo bo nyid yin gyi mi rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung zhes bya ba 'dis chos nyid de ngo bo nyid yin gyi mi rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa de /
translated: The phrase “whether the Tathagatas arise or not” teaches that this dharmata is the essence of form and not impermanent.

original: gang kun brtags pa'i gzugs des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su ngo bo nyid med pa kho na zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: gang kun brtags pa'i gzugs des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su ngo bo nyid med pa kho na zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The phrase “the imputed form is permanent, permanent time, and eternal, eternal time” teaches that the imputed form is not the essence of form.🔽The phrase “the dharmata form is just essenceless” teaches that the dharmata form is the essence of form.🔽The phrase “the dharmata form” refers to the very appearance in the nonconceptual mind.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid sngar smos pa'i kun brtags pa brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par byed pa'i rnam pas 'du shes dang / gdags par 'os pa'i bdag nyid dang bral bar gyur pa @287b de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid sngar smos pa'i kun brtags pa brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par byed pa'i rnam pas 'du shes dang / gdags par 'os pa'i bdag nyid dang bral bar gyur pa @287b de'i tshe /
translated: The phrase “free from the identity of the imputed form that is to be expressed and the expression” teaches that the dharmata form is free from the identity of the imputed form that is to be expressed and the expression that expresses it.

original: bdag nyid kyi brjod du med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i rnam pa de la chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi brjod du med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i rnam pa de la chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of the reality-limit which is the non-conceptual nature of the inexpressible self is called the form of reality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of own-being is because of the absence of the imagined own-being.

original: chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa med pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of dharmas is the absence of the aspect of the self of dharmas.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the unmistaken aspect.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The limit of reality is the culmination of that kind of aspect.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply this to feeling, etc.

original: byams pa gang kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su med par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa gang kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su med par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Maitreya, the imagined form should be seen as non-existent as a substance.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par blta bar bya zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir de yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par blta bar bya zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir de yod pa'o //
translated: The form that is imagined is substantially existent because the imagination exists substantially.

original: 'dus byas kyi tshul gyi 'jig pa dang / gzugs su yod pa'i phyir rdzas yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi tshul gyi 'jig pa dang / gzugs su yod pa'i phyir rdzas yin te /
translated: It is substantially existent because it is the mode of the conditioned and because it exists as form.

original: de bas rnam par brtags par yod pa nyid dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas rnam par brtags par yod pa nyid dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be substantially existent because it is both imagined and substantial.

original: rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
translated: It is not independent because it is the nature of the other-dependent.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni rdzas su med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni rdzas su med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The form that is reality is neither substantially existent nor inexistent.

original: rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not substantially existent because it is not independent.🔽It is not inexistent because it is the object of the highest direct intuition.

original: don dam pas rab tu bye ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: don dam pas rab tu bye ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid gzugs so //
translated: It is the form that is reality because it is the object of the highest direct intuition.

original: de brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not correct to say that it does not exist because it exists in the nature of the inexpressible.

original: de bas na rdzas su med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzas su med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not nonexistent as a substance.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i rnam par yod pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i rnam par yod pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod du yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not correct to say that it exists because it exists in the form of an imagined entity.

original: de bas na rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not existent as a substance.

original: de'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having rejected the two extremes, the middle way is taught.

original: don dam pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “distinguished by the ultimate” means “having the nature of the ultimate.”

original: rab tu phye zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: rab tu phye zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid kyi don to //
translated: The word “distinguished” has the meaning of “nature.”

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha'i bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha'i bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other [aspects], up to the ultimate qualities of a buddha.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum smos nas /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum smos nas /
translated: Thus, having mentioned the three natures based on the three natures,

original: yang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'phags pa byams pas gsol pa /
analyzed: yang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'phags pa byams pas gsol pa /
translated: Again, in order to open the section on the teaching of the defining characteristics of non-duality, Arya Maitreya asks:

original: sngar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor bsdus pa gtan la phab pa'i skabs su zhu ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sngar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor bsdus pa gtan la phab pa'i skabs su zhu ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the section on the previously determined brief perfection of wisdom, the twenty-eight questions are taught as follows:

original: @288a * // gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su byas pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //🔽byams pa de ji snyam du sems kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rdzas su med pa nyid gang yin pa de /
analyzed: @288a * // gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su byas pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to // byams pa de ji snyam du sems kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rdzas su med pa nyid gang yin pa de /
translated: The Blessed One said, This so-called form is made into a non-dual number. Thus it is said, and so on.🔽Maitreya, what do you think? The non-substantiality of imagined form, is that form or not? and so on.

original: gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs 'di gsum la so sor gzugs sam gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba med pa de gnyis su med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs 'di gsum la so sor gzugs sam gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba med pa de gnyis su med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: These three kinds of form—imaginary, conceptually differentiated, and real nature—are not individually form or not form, and that nonduality is thusness and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de bas na gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i sgras /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i sgras /
translated: Therefore, by the words “form,” “feeling,” and so on,🔽thusness is counted as nondual.

original: de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i grangs su bgrang bar byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i grangs su bgrang bar byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nyid bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach just that,

original: gzugs rnam pa gsum po de dag re re la yang /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa gsum po de dag re re la yang /
translated: he says, “In each of those three kinds of form,

original: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa las rnam par grol pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang por kun brtags pa'i gzugs la brtsams nas /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa las rnam par grol pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang por kun brtags pa'i gzugs la brtsams nas /
translated: in order to teach the characteristic of liberation from form and not form, he begins with imaginary form and says,

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rdzas su med pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rdzas su med pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Is that which is substantially nonexistent in imaginary form form or not?”

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: Imagined form does not exist as the identity of form, and so it is not suitable to say that it is the identity of form.

original: gzugs kyi ming dang gzugs su gdags pa dag de la yod pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ming dang gzugs su gdags pa dag de la yod pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the designation of form and the designation of the name of form exist in it, it is not suitable to say that it is not the identity of form.

original: de bas na de la gzugs zhes bya ba ming dang 'du shas dang ; btags pa dang tha snyad tsam nyid ces bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de la gzugs zhes bya ba ming dang 'du shas dang ; btags pa dang tha snyad tsam nyid ces bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that in this regard, what is called “form” is merely a name, an idea, a designation, and a convention.

original: ji ga de ni gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs su btags pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ga de ni gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs su btags pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: “Is that form?” means that since it is not form by the power of the designation of form,

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin pas /
translated: and since it is not form because it does not have the identity of form,

original: gnyis su med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is not dual.

original: byams pa de ji snyam du sems rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ji ga gzugs ma yin pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i de'i gzugs de yang gzugs kyi bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi🔽ngo bo nyid med pa yang @288b ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa de ji snyam du sems rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ji ga gzugs ma yin pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i de'i gzugs de yang gzugs kyi bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa yang @288b ma yin no //
translated: That imagined form of his is not without form, because it appears as the nature of form.

original: don dam par gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of form, because it is the nature that is free from the notion of form in the ultimate.

original: de bas na rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs des de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs des de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “that imagined form of his is not the nature of form, nor is it the characteristic of form, and yet it is form.”

original: de ltar rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de gzugs su 'du shes su rung ba'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du snang bas gzugs med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de gzugs su 'du shes su rung ba'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du snang bas gzugs med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: In this way, that imagined form is not without form, because it appears as the nature of form that is suitable to be the notion of form.

original: don dam par gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin pas gnyis su med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin pas gnyis su med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since ultimately there is no characteristic of form, it is not form. The meaning is that it is nondual.🔽Is that form which is distinguished by the selflessness of the reality of form the reality of form?

original: gang chos nyid kyi gzugs bdag med pas rab tu phye ba de ji ga gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs de mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma
analyzed: gang chos nyid kyi gzugs bdag med pas rab tu phye ba de ji ga gzugs yin nam zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs de mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma
translated: The reality of form is not the reality of form because the reality of form is the nature of the absence of all signs.

original: yin no // gzugs kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // gzugs kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not not the reality of form because the reality of form is the nature of the reality of form.

original: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs de nyid kyi gzugs kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin pa yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs de nyid kyi gzugs kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin pa yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, is the reality of form which is the reality of form not form?

original: chos nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin gzugs kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang ma yin gzugs kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i don to //
translated: Because it is the nature of reality, which is not non-existent, it is not form; because it is the reality of form, it is not non-form. This is the meaning of non-duality.

original: de bas na de ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na de ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is counted as non-dual.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi grangs su byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi grangs su byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means it is counted as suchness.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug gi bar du gnyis su med par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug gi bar du gnyis su med par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the ultimate qualities of a Buddha, one should apply non-duality.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug gi bar du gnyis su med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug gi bar du gnyis su med par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown the non-duality of form, etc., up to the ultimate qualities of a Buddha,

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa gzhan gyis bden pa bzhi po dag la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang yongs su shes pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa gzhan gyis bden pa bzhi po dag la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang yongs su shes pa yang ma yin /
translated: then, in order to show the characteristic of non-duality in the four noble truths by another aspect, it is said: It is not fully understood,

original: yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin pa de nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin pa de nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That very non-complete knowledge is his complete knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa ma yin gyi /🔽nyan thos ltar mnyam par ma bzhag par yongs su @289a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa ma yin gyi / nyan thos ltar mnyam par ma bzhag par yongs su @289a * //
translated: The bodhisattva does not have complete knowledge through the mental attention of the sameness of the characteristics of all dharmas.🔽But through the knowledge of familiarity, he has complete knowledge through non-equipoise,

original: 'dris pa'i shes pas ni yongs su shes te ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i shes pas ni yongs su shes te ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: like the śrāvaka, as previously explained.

original: de bas na de ltar shin tu yongs su shes pa ma yin pa 'di nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar shin tu yongs su shes pa ma yin pa 'di nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this very non-complete knowledge is his complete knowledge.

original: de bzhin du spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to abandonment, realization, and cultivation.

original: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa de 'byung ba la mkhas par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa de 'byung ba la mkhas par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the expertise in arising for one who is thus skilled in the characteristic of non-duality,🔽he says,

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni zab po mchog tu zab po zhes bya bas mya ngan las 'das pa ston to //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni zab po mchog tu zab po zhes bya bas mya ngan las 'das pa ston to //
translated: Maitreya, the nirvana of the bodhisattvas is profound, supremely profound.🔽He asks, “How is it profound?”

original: ji ltar zab ces zhus pa dang / 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar zab ces zhus pa dang / 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is taught: Because it is neither nirvana,

original: mya ngan las ma 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las ma 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor not nirvana,

original: de'i phyir zab pa dang / mchog tu zab ces bya'o zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zab pa dang / mchog tu zab ces bya'o zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: it is called profound, supremely profound.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag pa gnas gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag pa gnas gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: The so-called nirvana of the bodhisattvas is the thoroughly pure transformation.

original: gnas gyur pa de yang /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa de yang /
translated: And that transformation

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: is the nature of the complete nirvana of all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience, and the nature of the complete nirvana of the maturation of karma.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is nirvana.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag lta bur ma yin gyi 'khor ba yod kyi bar du /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag lta bur ma yin gyi 'khor ba yod kyi bar du /
translated: It is not like the disciples and hermit buddhas,

original: sems can gyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad de /
translated: but acts for the welfare of living beings as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not nirvana.

original: de nas byams pas gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas byams pas gsol pa /
translated: Then Maitreya asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
translated: “Lord, if bodhisattvas, beginning with the altruistic intention,

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
translated: do not abandon cyclic existence,

original: 'dis ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: how can they not abandon nirvana?”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba yod kyi bar du sems can gyi don rgyun mi gcod par rtag tu 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba yod kyi bar du sems can gyi don rgyun mi gcod par rtag tu 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
translated: If bodhisattvas, beginning with the altruistic intention, do not abandon cyclic existence, but rather act for the welfare of living beings as long as cyclic existence lasts,

original: de lta na mya ngan las 'das par ji ltar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na mya ngan las 'das par ji ltar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: how can they attain nirvana?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said,

original: byams pa gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: byams pa gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
translated: “Maitreya, beginning with the altruistic intention,

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nirvana, because it does not abandon samsara.

original: bdag gi don las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong bas mya ngan las 'das pa @289b 'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong bas mya ngan las 'das pa @289b 'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is not nirvana, because it does not abandon nirvana, beginning with the goal of self.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas /
translated: The Lord, beginning with the goal of others,

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi len te /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi len te /
translated: does not abandon samsara and does not accept nirvana which is the nonexistence of the personality aggregates.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa 'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa 'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not nirvana.

original: bdag gi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gi don las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the goal of self,

original: bya ba byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong zhing 'khor ba yang mi len te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong zhing 'khor ba yang mi len te /
translated: he does not abandon nirvana because his task is done, and he does not accept samsara.🔽Therefore, it is nirvana.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: chos kyi sku las brtsams te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the Dharma Body,

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: chos kyi sku las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is based on the Dharma Body.

original: sprul pa'i sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i dbang gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i dbang gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not based on the Transformation Body or the Body of Enjoyment.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi don las brtsams te 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na 'khor ba yongs su ma btang bas 'dis ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi don las brtsams te 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na 'khor ba yongs su ma btang bas 'dis ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la
translated: If the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not abandon the life-cycle, beginning with the aim of others, then how can he not abandon Nirvana?

original: sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the sense of the question.

original: gal te gzhan gyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong na /
translated: If he does not abandon the life-cycle for the sake of others,

original: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will not abandon Nirvana.

original: gal te bdag gi don du mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong na 'dis 'khor ba yongs su btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi don du mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong na 'dis 'khor ba yongs su btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not abandon Nirvana for his own sake, then he will abandon the life-cycle.

original: de bas na 'khor ba'i yongs su mi gtong ba dang / gtong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba de dag 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba'i yongs su mi gtong ba dang / gtong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba de dag 'gal ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, since samsara and nirvana are mutually exclusive,

original: de ji ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: how can they be non-contradictory?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la yang 'khor ba nyid du rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pas mi 'gal bar ston to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la yang 'khor ba nyid du rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pas mi 'gal bar ston to //
translated: Then the Lord teaches non-contradiction with “In samsara, he does not conceive of samsara.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog cing mnyam pa nyid tsam du mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog cing mnyam pa nyid tsam du mthong bas /
translated: The bodhisattva, not conceiving of any dharma, seeing only sameness,

original: 'khor ba la 'khor ba'o zhes spros pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes spros pas spros par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'khor ba la 'khor ba'o zhes spros pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes spros pas spros par mi byed de /
translated: does not fabricate samsara as samsara, nor nirvana as nirvana.

original: de bas na mnyam pa nyid la gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na mnyam pa nyid la gnas so //
translated: Therefore, he abides in sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas na gang la yang nyes dmigs su mthong bas blo zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la yang phan yon du mthong bas sbyor bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med @290a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas na gang la yang nyes dmigs su mthong bas blo zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la yang phan yon du mthong bas sbyor bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med @290a * //
translated: Since they abide in equality, they do not become discouraged by seeing any faults in anything, nor do they engage in anything by seeing any benefits in anything.

original: do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nas 'phags pa byams pa des kyang ma mgu nas bcom ldan 'das 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas pas /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa byams pa des kyang ma mgu nas bcom ldan 'das 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas pas /
translated: Then the noble Maitreya, displeased, asked the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān, if bodhisattvas abide in the nonconceptual realm,

original: 'khor ba ji ltar ma btang ba de ltar blangs pa yang ma mchis shing mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar ma btang ba de ltar blangs pa ma mchis par yang mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji ltar ma btang ba de ltar blangs pa yang ma mchis shing mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar ma btang ba de ltar blangs pa ma mchis par yang mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: then they would neither take up saṃsāra as they do nor take up nirvāṇa as they do.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te blangs pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te blangs pa ma mchis na /
translated: “Bhagavān, if they do not take up,

original: ji ltar ma btang ba lags zhes bya ba zhus te /
analyzed: ji ltar ma btang ba lags zhes bya ba zhus te /
translated: how do they not give up?”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par mi rtog pas /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par mi rtog pas /
translated: If bodhisattvas, through nonconceptuality,

original: mnyam pa nyid dmigs na /🔽de lta na ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gtong ba yang med /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dmigs na / de lta na ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gtong ba yang med /
translated: If one observes sameness,🔽then one would say that there is neither giving up samsara nor

original: len pa yang med do zhes bya na /
analyzed: len pa yang med do zhes bya na /
translated: attaining nirvana.

original: de la gal gal te len pa med na ji ltar btang bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de la gal gal te len pa med na ji ltar btang bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Here, if there is no attaining, how could there be giving up?

original: byams pa da ni 'di ltar 'khor ba len to zhe'am mi len to zhes mi smra'o zhes bya bas 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa da ni 'di ltar 'khor ba len to zhe'am mi len to zhes mi smra'o zhes bya bas 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: Maitreya, now I do not say that samsara is attained in this way or that it is not attained.

original: nga ni 'khor ba spong ba dang mi spong ba'i dbang gis len pa dang / 'dor bar mi smra'i /
analyzed: nga ni 'khor ba spong ba dang mi spong ba'i dbang gis len pa dang / 'dor bar mi smra'i /
translated: I do not say that samsara is attained or given up in terms of being abandoned or not abandoned.

original: dgos pa la ltos nas bya ba byed pa'i dbang gis smra ste /
analyzed: dgos pa la ltos nas bya ba byed pa'i dbang gis smra ste /
translated: I say that in terms of the performance of function in dependence on a need.

original: 'di ltar mngon par shes pa'i mthus dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su sems can gyi khams kyi don shin tu rgyun mi 'byed par byed de /
