analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par shes pa'i mthus dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su sems can gyi khams kyi don shin tu rgyun mi 'byed par byed de /
translated: Thus, by the power of superknowledge, I always and everywhere in limitless world systems perform the benefit of the realm of sentient beings without interruption.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhes smra'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhes smra'i /
translated: Therefore, I say that I do not give up samsara.

original: 'khor ba mi spong ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba mi spong ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not because they do not abandon cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i dbyings nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i dbyings nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Thus, having taken up the emptiness-realm, the non-apprehended realm,

original: de la gnas te /
analyzed: de la gnas te /
translated: they abide in it.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa len to zhes smra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa len to zhes smra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they take up nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dus pa ji ltar blta bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dus pa ji ltar blta bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Blessed One, how should one view the characteristic of non-conceptuality?”

original: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin pa lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin pa lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: “How is non-conceptuality perfected and completed?”

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Non-duality of existence and non-existence” means

original: yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya ba'i gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya ba'i gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: not being dualistic about existence and non-existence.

original: spros pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spros pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Free from elaborations” means

original: chos de rnams la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos de rnams la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: not conceptualizing those phenomena in any way whatsoever.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags nyan thos thams cad gcig tu nges par gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags nyan thos thams cad gcig tu nges par gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One, are all the Sravakas definitely fixed in the Nirvana without remainder?

original: byang @290b chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor ba mi len to zhes 'byung bas nyan thos rnams len pa med par shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang @290b chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor ba mi len to zhes 'byung bas nyan thos rnams len pa med par shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
translated: This is because it says, The Bodhisattvas do not take up cyclic existence, and he thinks, The Sravakas would be completely fixed in Nirvana without remainder, without taking up anything.🔽 The many different dispositions and natures of sentient beings are observed.

original: sems can rnams kyi rigs dang / rang bzhin mang du dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rigs rnams dang / rang bzhin rnams mang ba ste rigs ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rigs dang / rang bzhin mang du dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rigs rnams dang / rang bzhin rnams mang ba ste rigs ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three kinds of dispositions.

original: rang bzhin yang bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams so //🔽bzang po'i bye brag don du gnyer te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams so // bzang po'i bye brag don du gnyer te /
translated: Natures are also different, by the distinctions of intention, latent propensities, inclinations, faculties, and so on.🔽They strive for the attainment of a specific good.

original: bzang po'i bye brag nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzang po'i bye brag nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They will attain a specific good means

original: dang po nyid nas rang bzhin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod la /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas rang bzhin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod la /
translated: From the very beginning, he desires natural, perfect enlightenment.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa'o //
translated: He obtains it just as he desires.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Inferior means

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po //
translated: the enlightenment of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: dman par shes nas de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dman par shes nas de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag tu 'gyur te /
translated: Having understood the inferiority, he does not consider that to be sufficient.

original: nyan thos nyid thob nas phyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos nyid thob nas phyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He becomes an arya person, and after attaining the state of a sravaka, he becomes a buddha.🔽How can he attain it without being born?

original: skye ba ma mchis pas ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar skyes na ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pas ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar skyes na ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: He thinks that if he is born in samsara, he can complete the requisites for enlightenment.

original: de'i skye ba lags par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ma stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i skye ba lags par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ma stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Lord has not said that he is born.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni 'dir srid pa brgyad pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni 'dir srid pa brgyad pa mi skyed do //
translated: Here, the stream-enterer does not produce an eighth existence.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'dir srid pa gcig len to //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'dir srid pa gcig len to //
translated: The once-returner takes up one more existence here.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dir srid pa gcig kyang mi len to //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dir srid pa gcig kyang mi len to //
translated: The non-returner does not take up any more existence here.

original: dgra bcom pa ni thams cad du yang srid pa mi len to de ltar skye ba bkag go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni thams cad du yang srid pa mi len to de ltar skye ba bkag go //
translated: The arhat does not take up any more existence anywhere. Thus birth is refuted.

original: byams pa de'i skye ba las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur bar ni nga mi 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: byams pa de'i skye ba las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur bar ni nga mi 'dogs kyi /
translated: Maitreya, I do not posit that birth is due to the power of karma and the afflictions.

original: de'i skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sprul pa dang yongs su bsngos pa'o zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sprul pa dang yongs su bsngos pa'o zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: I posit that birth is due to the inconceivable, due to emanation, and due to transformation.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba zhes bya ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba zhes bya ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: Birth due to the power of karma and the afflictions refers to stream-enterers and so on.

original: skye ba rnam pa gsum po dag la ni dpyad pa med do //
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa gsum po dag la ni dpyad pa med do //
translated: But there is no analysis of the three types of birth.

original: de dag la ni skye ba rnam gsum yod de /
analyzed: de dag la ni skye ba rnam gsum yod de /
translated: They have three types of birth:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye ba dang sprul pa'i skye ba dang / smon lam gyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye ba dang sprul pa'i skye ba dang / smon lam gyi skye ba'o //
translated: inconceivable birth, emanation birth, and aspirational birth.

original: de la gang nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de la gang nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa de dag ni /
translated: Those of the Śrāvaka lineage who are not definite are

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gyur na /🔽de'i tshe de bzhin gsheg @291a * //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gyur na / de'i tshe de bzhin gsheg @291a * //
translated: if they approach the Tathāgata,

original: pas de dag gi rigs kyi khyad par la gzigs nas /
analyzed: pas de dag gi rigs kyi khyad par la gzigs nas /
translated: then the Tathāgata sees the specific lineage of those🔽and explains the Dharma in such a way that they generate the desire to attain

original: ji ltar de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa bskyed pa de lta bu'i chos bshad pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: ji ltar de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa bskyed pa de lta bu'i chos bshad pa mdzad nas /
translated: unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: de lta bu'i lam la sbyor te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam la sbyor te /
translated: He connects them to such a path.

original: 'dod pa de yongs su ma btang bar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa de yongs su ma btang bar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas /
translated: Without giving up that desire, they actualize the limit of reality

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par byed do //
translated: and attain the fruit of stream entry and so on.🔽Thus, because the buddhas are skilled in methods, they establish all those

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams thabs mkhas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la bkod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams thabs mkhas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la bkod nas /
translated: in the path to omniscience by means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: slob pa'am mi slob par gyur pa la /
analyzed: slob pa'am mi slob par gyur pa la /
translated: They become either learners or nonlearners.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma btang bas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed kyang nges pa'i nyan thos ltar /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma btang bas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed kyang nges pa'i nyan thos ltar /
translated: Although they manifest nirvana, they do not give up their desire for unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de la shin tu drag po'i mos pa mi skyed de /
analyzed: de la shin tu drag po'i mos pa mi skyed de /
translated: They do not generate the intense aspiration of the fixed śrāvakas.

original: dper na la la zhig grong ngam grong khyer la lta ba na /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig grong ngam grong khyer la lta ba na /
translated: For example, when someone looks at a village or city,

original: de nyid du gnas par bya'o snyam du bsams te bltas na ni /
analyzed: de nyid du gnas par bya'o snyam du bsams te bltas na ni /
translated: if they think, “I will stay right here,”

original: der mos par mos pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan du 'gro'o snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: der mos par mos pa gzhan du 'gyur ro // gzhan du 'gro'o snyam du bsams te /
translated: their aspiration to stay there changes.🔽If they think,

original: bltas na ni blo gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bltas na ni blo gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: “I will go elsewhere,” their mind changes.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod na ni /
translated: In the same way, if they desire complete enlightenment,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: their desire for nirvana changes

original: nges pa'i nyan thos rnams kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i nyan thos rnams kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: and they become different from the fixed śrāvakas.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa spangs kyang la la bag chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa spangs kyang la la bag chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even though they have abandoned the afflictions, they are distinguished by the power of their imprints, and so on.

original: snying rje'i bsam pa'i dbang gis kyang /
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pa'i dbang gis kyang /
translated: And by the power of their compassionate intention,

original: de dag 'khor bas shin tu skyo bar mi 'gyur la /🔽sems can la phan pa byed par 'dod pa rnams ni bu gzhon nu mi gtsang ba'i dong du ltung ba 'byin par 'dod pas mi gtsang ba'i dong la blta yang /
analyzed: de dag 'khor bas shin tu skyo bar mi 'gyur la / sems can la phan pa byed par 'dod pa rnams ni bu gzhon nu mi gtsang ba'i dong du ltung ba 'byin par 'dod pas mi gtsang ba'i dong la blta yang /
translated: they do not become weary of cyclic existence.

original: des skyo bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //🔽slob pa'am mi slob pa de lta bur gyur pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag gis 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa /
analyzed: des skyo bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no // slob pa'am mi slob pa de lta bur gyur pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag gis 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa /
translated: Those who wish to benefit sentient beings, like a mother who wishes to rescue her young child who has fallen into a cesspool, do not become weary of the cesspool.🔽Those learners and nonlearners, by the instructions of the Tathāgata, dedicate the roots of virtue of the supramundane uncontaminated ārya path and so on in this way.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'di ltar yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'di ltar yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: They dedicate them in this way:

original: gang bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa de dag thams cad sems can la phan pa'i phyir 'khor bar skye ba la mngon du phyogs par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa de dag thams cad sems can la phan pa'i phyir 'khor bar skye ba la mngon du phyogs par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: May all my roots of virtue, which are supramundane and uncontaminated, be directed toward birth in cyclic existence for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de dag de ltar yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis lam la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i dge ba rnams kyis 'khor bar skye bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag de ltar yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis lam la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i dge ba rnams kyis 'khor bar skye bar byed de /
translated: Through the power of dedicating those roots of virtue to samsara, they generate birth in samsara through uncontaminated virtue such as the path.

original: de dag la yang @291b lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen du gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams yod de /
analyzed: de dag la yang @291b lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen du gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams yod de /
translated: Moreover, they possess virtuous phenomena that are similar to afflictions that act as cooperating conditions.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan dag las blo gros rgya mtsho 'khor ba'i rgyun byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan dag las blo gros rgya mtsho 'khor ba'i rgyun byed la /
translated: For example, other sutras state:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: Sāgaramati, what are the afflictions that are concomitant with roots of virtue that perpetuate the continuum of samsara?

original: 'di lta ste bsod nams kyi tshogs btsal bas yongs su mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par smon pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsod nams kyi tshogs btsal bas yongs su mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par smon pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: They are being insatiable in seeking the accumulation of merit, taking up birth in samsara through intention, aspiring to meet with buddhas, not being discouraged in ripening sentient beings,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod snyam pa la spro ba dang / chos 'dod pa'i bag la nyal mi 'dor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod snyam pa la spro ba dang / chos 'dod pa'i bag la nyal mi 'dor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: They are: striving to uphold the holy Dharma; being eager to do whatever needs to be done for sentient beings; not giving up the latent tendency to desire the teachings; and not abandoning the practice of the perfections.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: Sāgaramati, these are the afflictions that are associated with the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis 'dre yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis 'dre yang /
translated: Even though bodhisattvas mix with them,

original: nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams kyis mi gos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams kyis mi gos so //
translated: they are not tainted by the faults of the afflictions.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba lags na ci'i slad du nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba lags na ci'i slad du nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bgyi /
translated: ” He continued, “Blessed One, if they are roots of virtue, why are they called afflictions?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di ltar nyon mongs pa de lta bu dag gis byang chub sems dpa' khams gsum dang 'dre zhing /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di ltar nyon mongs pa de lta bu dag gis byang chub sems dpa' khams gsum dang 'dre zhing /
translated: “Sāgaramati, in this way, the afflictions cause bodhisattvas to mix with the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin pas de la byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas bsams bzhin du khams gsum du 'dre'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin pas de la byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas bsams bzhin du khams gsum du 'dre'o //
translated: The three realms arise from the afflictions. Therefore, the bodhisattva, through the power of skillful means and the power of the roots of virtue, intentionally mixes with the three realms.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the afflictions are associated with the roots of virtue.

original: khams gsum du 'dres pas de skad bya'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khams gsum du 'dres pas de skad bya'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because they mix with the three realms, they are called that, but not because the mind is afflicted.

original: de bas na de ltar yongs su bsngos pa'i mthus zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis srid par skye'o zhes bya'o //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar yongs su bsngos pa'i mthus zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis srid par skye'o zhes bya'o // phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: Therefore, through the power of such a dedication, the uncontaminated roots of virtue are reborn in existence.

original: dgra bcom pa la la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pas /
translated: Some non-returners or arhats, through the power of concentration,

original: mngon par shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skye ba bstan nas /
translated: through possessing special supernormal knowledge, manifest various kinds of birth through emanations.

original: sems can rnams kyi don dpag tu med pa byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don dpag tu med pa byed cing /
translated: They benefit countless sentient beings and

original: byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de ni sprul pa'i skye ba zhes bya'o //🔽la la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mthus /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de ni sprul pa'i skye ba zhes bya'o // la la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mthus /
translated: they complete the accumulations for enlightenment. This is called “emanation birth.”

original: de lta bu'i @292a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i @292a * //
translated: Some, through the power of relying on a spiritual friend,🔽make special prayers

original: smon lam gyi khyad par dag thog ma nas bstsags par gyur te /
analyzed: smon lam gyi khyad par dag thog ma nas bstsags par gyur te /
translated: to be born in a certain place.

original: de dag gi smon lam de dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas yongs su bsngos pa'i skye ba dag sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gi smon lam de dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas yongs su bsngos pa'i skye ba dag sgrub par byed de /
translated: When their prayers are fulfilled, they are born in that place.

original: de ni yongs su bsngos pa'i skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su bsngos pa'i skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “prayer birth.”

original: 'o na de dag ci'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ma thob par /
analyzed: 'o na de dag ci'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ma thob par /
translated: Why don’t they attain the result of stream enterer and so forth

original: byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed ce na /
translated: and complete the factors for enlightenment?

original: med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not have the result of stream enterer and so forth.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni nyon mongs pa shas che la dbang po rtul te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni nyon mongs pa shas che la dbang po rtul te /
translated: Because they have a great many afflictions and dull faculties,

original: dbang po sbyang bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus te ;
analyzed: dbang po sbyang bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus te ;
translated: Without training the faculties and abandoning the afflictions, one cannot complete the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas de dag la de lta bu'i mthu mchog dang ldan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas de dag la de lta bu'i mthu mchog dang ldan par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the skillful tathāgatas have endowed them with such supreme power.

original: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: As it is said in other sūtras:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa de dag ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa de dag ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should we view those śrāvakas whom the Tathāgata has prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:
